7:40.race_name: Try Unibet's New Smartview Racecards Handicap (A Jockey Club Grassroots Mile Series Qualifier)

runners.name: Silver Samurai
runners.owner: What A Time To Be Alive 1
runners.comment: Lot to like and can play a part if it sets up for the closers
runners.spotlight: Last run in Class 4 company resulted in a win at Newmarket (2023); 0-12 on AW but his best RPR on it was achieved when runner-up over C&D in January 2024; can play a part if it sets up for the closers; wears this headgear combination for the first time.

quotes.race: JenningsBet Grey Horse Handicap
quotes.quote: The race worked out perfectly for Silver Samurai as I was able to smuggle him into the race and he has that one kick that proved decisive -  Andrea Atzeni, rider.

quotes.race: Coolmore Stud Handicap
quotes.quote: Silver Samurai has ability and has been unlucky. It's important to get the timing right with him. He has a strong finish, but sometimes the pace isn't quick enough for him. Nice six-furlong handicaps will be the plan and we'll enter in the Wokingham and see; he handled the track well there last week - Marco Botti, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He is a horse I have always liked and he has done well, winning four times. In fact his win last time out at Newbury maintained his record of winning each season he has raced. He ran well at Ascot earlier this month and seemed so well we felt he should go to Newbury for the Class 2 handicap earlier this month. We have learned that 6f is his trip as they got that stride faster over that trip and he loves to travel in his races. He showed a wonderful turn of foot to win off a mark of 88 and has gone up to 92 now, but I suspect I need a further 5lb if he is to make it into the Wokingham at Royal Ascot. We have a few options for him in the next week or two, notably at Haydock this weekend or Epsom the following week. If things worked out and he won and made it then Royal Ascot would be a great day out, but if not there will be more good days for him this year, particularly now we have finally worked out his trip. 25-05-22

runners.name: Hieronymus
runners.comment: Type to bounce back, particularly if getting his own way in front (could happen)
runners.spotlight: All five wins here (7f/1m), most recent came at the main expense of Tiger Crusade; not nearly as effective last time but is the type to bounce back, particularly if getting his own way in front (there isn't loads of pace on paper).

quotes.race: Unibet Casino Deposit £10 Get £40 Bonus Handicap
quotes.quote: Hieronymus is quite a simple ride and it was just a case of going forward and we've got it very easy in front. We thought he'd stay the mile and he showed a good turn of foot from the front. He keeps galloping and saw it out well. It's great to be back - Nicola Currie, jockey.

runners.name: Farasi Lane

prev_owners.owner: M Webber, M T Ward & Schiff Family
M Webber, M T Ward & Schiff Family

runners.comment: Percentage call is to oppose given 1m is probably his best trip; drawn wider than ideal
runners.spotlight: Two wins and a short-head second from six visits here; went agonisingly close in the Lincoln trial at Wolverhampton in March; uncompetitive since and 1m is probably his best trip; drawn wider than ideal.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Extra Places Handicap (London Mile Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Farasi Lane's homework had been brilliant and he was second here last month, which could be considered a career-best and that's amazing for a 6yo to still be improving. That's probably a career-best again and hopefully it shows what we can do with these older horses. There's a 0-90 on Guineas day I've been thinking about, although he might not get in it now - Jamie Insole, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Racingbreaks Ryder
runners.owner: Cottier, Racing Breaks & Old Gold Racing
runners.comment: Major question mark over his affinity with AW; low down the list
runners.spotlight: Threatening another win before easing to 4l success at Catterick in October; second go on AW 44 days ago can be excused (came off a break and was left poorly placed) but a disappointing first attempt came during a good spell on turf.

stable_tour.quote: He's in good shape and runs at Newmarket on Tuesday. He did superbly last year when he won his first three, but obviously that meant his mark shot up. He likes to get his toe in and might be at the top of his mark, but he's a year older, so he could easily have improved. 17-04-24

This genuine colt has given his owners a lot of fun since rounding off last season with victory in a Brighton novice. That earned him a rating of 79 and he hasn't stopped improving. First time out this year he won at Nottingham by a short head, followed up off a 5lb higher mark at Haydock and then put up his most impressive performance at Ascot over 7f when making it four in a row, this time off 90. He has been a joy to train and his work leading to this week has been as good as ever, so it's all systems go for the Britannia on Thursday, and rain would help him. He has form on fast ground but is such a tough horse that I feel the harder it is for his rivals the more chance he has. His key attribute is how he travels in his races and that will be a major plus for him this week. 21-06-23

runners.name: Nibras Angel
runners.comment: Pleasing stable debut but might again get going too late
runners.spotlight: Quite highly tried after winning her first two starts for Ismail Mohammed; did best of the hold-up horses when making the frame on stable debut over C&D last month (off 189-day break) but might again get going too late if she's dropped in from the widest stall; tongue-tie returns.

quotes.race: Robert (Bob) Vickery Memorial Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We worked Nibras Angel before the race and we really think she's a quality filly. We work her with most of our horses and she runs away from everybody. I was worried two or three days ago because a horse kicked her in the bit on Warren Hill, she made lots of noise, but she was fine. We have to see how she'll come out of the race, I don't know if we'll go directly to the Sun Chariot or find a Group 3 or a Listed race for her. She didn't run as a two-year-old and when we work her she's still babyish and green - Ismail Mohammed, trainer.

runners.name: Habrdi
runners.owner: Fine Claret Racing, Mr&Mrs Knox, R Carr
runners.comment: Hopes pinned on him returning to AW (he's 2-4 on artificial surfaces)
runners.spotlight: Starting out for fourth different trainer when failing to beat a rival at Doncaster in March; hopes pinned on him returning to AW (he's 2-4 on artificial surfaces); rail draw.

quotes.race: Docker Hughes Memorial EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (For horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Habrdi was unlucky in the sales race. I thought he was going to run a big race there but unfortunately he was the first to load and it seemed like he was in there for ten minutes. It was slow loading with such a big field of two-year-olds. He fell asleep at the start and just blew his chance, hence why I ran him back quick and he went and did the job - Jane Chapple-Hyam, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a new arrival, recently gelded, who had his first race for Mowbray at Doncaster's Lincoln meeting. He was drawn in stall two and was caught wide on the wing, which caused him to run with the choke out. He was gassy and tired after the race, but the run will have done him good. We'll wait to see what the handicapper does, but I've a feeling some good handicaps await this fellow. 09-04-25

runners.name: Pitney
runners.comment: Stable debut; do well to land a race as competitive as this off a 249-day break
runners.spotlight: Doubled his tally for Hugo Palmer last time out but was quickly sold for 8,000gns; do well to land a race as competitive as this off a 249-day break.

runners.name: Follow Your Heart
runners.comment: Could easily secure win number three of the year back on AW
runners.spotlight: Won twice already this year, beating Hieronymus over C&D in February and Pressure's On at Wolverhampton in March; doesn't really like grass so his seventh at Haydock 11 days ago isn't worth dwelling on.

runners.name: Tiger Crusade
runners.comment: Same excuse the last twice but has won just once in getting on for two years
runners.spotlight: This hold-up performer had no real hope of taking a hand in the finish given how things panned out here the last twice; has won just once in getting on for two years so can probably be opposed.

quotes.race: Every Race Live On Racing TV Handicap
quotes.quote: Tiger Crusade has a lower mark on turf as he has not won for a long time but he stays seven furlongs and on that slightly tacky ground he was always going to finish off six furlongs well. He has been running on quicker ground on the turf, but I think he likes to get his toe in a little bit. That trip today on that ground was perfect for him - Bryan Payne, part owner.

stable_tour.quote: He's in great form and has come down the weights. I think he's ready to win as he's in that sort of area. He's another No Nay Never who enjoys the synthetics, but he's very capable on turf. He could finish only a never-dangerous sixth at Goodwood on Tuesday following a slow start. 04-09-24

runners.name: Newsreader
runners.comment: Perhaps best watched returning from a break with 7lb claimer up
runners.spotlight: Three wins over C&D last year; not nearly as effective elsewhere the last twice but wasn't seen to best effect (came from further back than ideal) last time; perhaps best watched returning from a break with 7lb claimer up.

runners.name: Pressures On
runners.breeder: S C E A Marmion Vauville Et Al
runners.comment: Fancied to build on earlier promise and make it 2-2 under Hector Crouch
runners.spotlight: Picked up where he left off last year, and possibly should have picked Follow Your Heart up, at Wolverhampton in March; raced keenly but was still bang there over a furlong out in the Spring Mile last time before weakening; fancied to build on earlier promise this evening; Hector Crouch is 1-1 on him.

runners.name: Bishops Crown
runners.comment: These conditions might make bouncing back difficult
runners.spotlight: Started his career running over 7f/1m but has done his winning over 6f on turf; disappointing favourite on his return to action last month and let down his supporters again 20 days ago (both AW).

stable_tour.quote: He has run seven times and in the last six of them has been placed. I still can't believe I have not won with him yet. He had been running over 1m so I dropped him to 7f and he was third, and last weekend he ran over 6f at Leicester and the poor old boy just found one too good again. He is a lovely horse and a win is surely around the corner. 11-07-23

runners.name: Al Ameen
runners.breeder: G H S Bloodstock & J C Bloodstock
runners.comment: Two 7f wins and a running-on fifth over 6f here of late; more to do off revised mark
runners.spotlight: Won decisively over C&D in March and April and shaped as if still in form when running on into fifth, having been drawn widest, over 6f here last time; good bit more to do off his revised mark (5lb higher than last time), though.

quotes.race: Betway Median Auction Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Al Ameen was slowly away on his debut and he walked out again. They went quick and he warmed into it. He got his head down and he tried very hard. He'll stay further. The fact he could win after a start like that was very encouraging - Callum Shepherd, jockey.

runners.name: Wobwobwob
runners.comment: Yet to do it on AW and is drawn wide
runners.spotlight: Backed into favouritism on his return to action over C&D a fortnight ago but shaped as if needing the run; not sure to leave that effort behind, though, given the rest of his AW form; drawn wide; goes without headgear.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Ayr Silver Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: It means a lot because there was a lot of money on Wobwobwob. I don't know who they were but I'm glad they backed a winner. It's a great race to win and the Gold Cup is on my bucket list, so hopefully this lad is heading in that direction. He loves this type of ground and a fast pace to aim at, and he's won over seven so stays the six furlongs really well. Hopefully he's one for the Gold next year. They went very hard but that suited him and he had something to aim at - Adrian Keatley, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: Off a light weight you're always conscious that you can probably get away with using that bit more gas early on than you normally could. Wobwobwob is very straightforward and he's a genuine little horse. I was expecting them to come chasing at the two pole but all he did was dig deep and get away from them. A top performance off the back of a nice run at Newmarket last time - Tom Marquand, jockey.

quotes.race: Dubai Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Wobwobwob is a tough horse and did it well from his draw on the rail - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

8:10.race_name: Try Unibet's New Improved Acca Boosts Handicap (London Sprint Series Qualifier)

runners.name: Al Barez
runners.comment: C&D win last spring; solid second at Wolverhampton last month; should be involved
runners.spotlight: Two AW wins last April, the former over C&D and then defying a 1lb higher mark than today's at Southwell; solid effort at Wolverhampton last month and likely to be involved once more.

quotes.race: Read Harry Cobden's Blog At Planet Sport Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: Al Barez was push-button to ride and I loved his attitude. He didn't win very far but I probably got there early enough because the pace collapsed - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Best Odds Daily Handicap (London Sprint Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Jack did well from that draw and it's nice to get a win on the board. The turf season is around the corner so I hope Al Barez is shaping up well for some nice handicaps this summer. He's still quite an unexposed horse and has a lovely pedigree - Tom Clover, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely horse and it was great to see him run well at Wolverhampton the other day after losing his form through the winter. He looks really well and he'll go to Windsor next. Hopefully he can carry on improving and win plenty of races. 14-05-25

runners.name: Drama
runners.comment: Boasts strong C&D form; good third in a Southwell 0-95 latest; big chance down in class
runners.spotlight: The form of last season's two C&D wins is strong and he confirmed his preference for AW with a good third at Southwell last month (6f, Class 3; blinkered first time), leading in the straight but picked off late by two slightly more efficiently ridden rivals; strong claims back down in grade.

quotes.race: Unibet London Sprint Series Final Handicap (Series Final - Qualified Horses Only)
quotes.quote: Drama was a little bit disappointing on his last run and, as Tom Marquand said, he just felt as if he'd had a couple of runs in quick succession and lacked that kick. Either way, this was the obvious choice having won here before and the team at home have done a great job freshening him up. This was a great opportunity but I'd love to get him on a bit of soft ground now. He's run plenty of good races on the turf and I think he's pretty versatile - James Ferguson, trainer.

runners.name: Many A Star
runners.comment: Three 6f Tapeta wins this year; held his form since but others perhaps better treated
runners.spotlight: Won three 6f Tapeta handicaps early in the year and he's held his form since, not far behind Drama at Southwell and only beaten 2l back on turf 16 days ago; suspicion a few might prove better treated.

quotes.race: Extra Winnings With BetUK Acca Club Handicap
quotes.quote: Many A Star did it well. With a horse of his age, especially at this sort of distance, when they're in good form it's best to keep rolling. He's a big horse and is taking his racing well. This track does really suit him as it gives him a long time to wind up. They went a strong gallop and he picked up a bit quicker than I thought he would, we were in front plenty long enough, but he's very game and it's a credit to Jamie [Osborne, trainer] and the team for keeping him in such good form - William Carver, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Coral Stewards' Sprint Handicap (Consolation Race For The Stewards' Cup)
quotes.quote: The ground is challenging and did not really suit Many A Star but he ran really well. He struggled a bit to get out as they all came in very tight and when he got out he did not pick up as we'd have liked but on this ground the softer-ground horses did better - Jeffrey Hobby, owner.

quotes.race: Coral Stewards' Sprint Handicap (Consolation race for The Stewards' Cup)
quotes.quote: The last time Many A Star ran at Newmarket six weeks ago there was no pace and he didn't run any race. We just thought after that race that he'd run a few times and decided to give him a break and it's all come to fruition. He gained weight during the break and he's looking better now. We might look at the Ayr Gold Cup - Oliver Cole, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Events At Ascot Handicap
quotes.quote: I think Many A Star is quite a nice horse. He has a bit of confidence now and I think he has come on from his last run at Goodwood. He stripped a bit fitter today and will probably go for a bigger handicap, but he loved that ground - Oliver Cole, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Seadeer Handicap
quotes.quote: Many A Star is a shell of a horse and will be nice next year. He enjoyed the ground - Andrea Atzeni, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He'll win again soon. Although he's won on soft ground, I think he's much better on a quicker surface. He'll either go back to the all-weather or we'll find quick ground for him. He's well capable with conditions in his favour. He'll probably drop in the handicap and will be tough to beat. 11-09-24

runners.name: Bright
runners.comment: Did well in the second half of 2024, winning three; returns from a short break; considered
runners.spotlight: Three wins in the second half of 2024; went close off this mark at Newcastle in January but failed to back it up nine days later; given a break since and Billy Loughnane's presence in the saddle suggests he'll be straight enough (two wins from four starts on him); not ruled out.

quotes.race: BetUK. It's Where The UK Bets Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bright is a lovely genuine horse. This was his first run for Mark (Loughnane) and they thought he might want six furlongs, but he wouldn't be screaming for them to step him up. He's very quick - Finley Marsh, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Albert Cee
runners.comment: Best efforts give him claims but he needs to leave a low-key stable debut behind him
runners.spotlight: Impressive at Leicester in September 2023 when trained by Peter Chapple-Hyam; also looked good when making a winning debut for James Owen at Chepstow last June (6f, good to soft) but made low-key return to action/stable debut at Doncaster in March; others look safer.

runners.name: Liosa
runners.comment: 2-2 over C&D and impressed last month; latest turf defeat excusable; could yet rate higher
runners.spotlight: Ended 2024 on the up and he confirmed himself a progressive sprinter when running out the impressive winner of a C&D handicap on last month's return from 169 days off (2-2 at Kempton); subsequent turf defeat off an 8lb lower mark is excusable (5f looked too sharp and he didn't look at ease on the track); should be seen to better effect today and may not have reached his ceiling.

runners.name: Scarboroughwarning
runners.comment: Big improver when last seen in October; 10lb better off with Liosa for 0.5l on latest run
runners.spotlight: Marked improvement in AW handicaps on final two outings last October, routing five rivals at Wolverhampton before chasing home Liosa over 6f at Southwell; 10lb better off with that rival for 0.5l but she's returning from 205 days off and will need to be cherry ripe.

runners.name: Tan Rapido
runners.comment: Best effort to date when 2nd at Southwell (5f) last month; return to 6f a plus; up 2lb
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo who ran his best race to date when second of 13 at Southwell last month (5f); the return to 6f can help but a 2lb nudge demands further progress.

runners.name: Night On Earth
runners.comment: Well-handicapped front-runner but 6f likely to stretch his stamina
runners.spotlight: Well-handicapped front-runner; latest Pontefract effort should have blown away any cobwebs and he's ideally berthed to attack; whether he can sustain his effort for 6f looks a moot point though.

quotes.race: Sky Bet "Jump Jockeys' Nunthorpe" Handicap (To Be Ridden By Professional Jump Jockeys)
quotes.quote: That was very different and a great thrill. It's a race I've wanted to ride in for the last two years but couldn't get a ride. You get a good start and then you let Night On Earth dictate, you're just a passenger. I felt the others coming to my girths but I always felt like I was digging out deep - Charlie Todd, jockey.

quotes.race: Betfred Handicap
quotes.quote: Night On Earth has got a lot of early pace and he put that to good use. He was drawn wide today and he's managed to get across early ? he really does have a lot of speed. We had worries about Epsom. We weren't too sure about how he'd manage it, but he's always struck us as a horse who might do well in the Dash and I think he coped with it better than we expected. Chester will be the next stop and then we'll hopefully come back for the Dash - Ian Williams, trainer.

quotes.race: British EBF Novice Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Night On Earth is another horse to look forward to. He's very relaxed at home so we started him over six but he's appreciated the drop back to five today and is clearly fast - Oisin Murphy, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He did not join us until the autumn but has done very well, winning three times, including his most recent race at Kempton earlier this month. He is pure speed and will stick to 5f. Having started off on 80 he is now up to 92. I hope he can do even better on the turf as he certainly looks the part and I think he is still on a very fair mark. 22-03-22

runners.name: Brunel Charm

prev_owners.owner: R Lane & Exors Of The Late S Needham

runners.comment: Conditions fine but he's up in class and needs to leave a low-key run at Lingfield behind
runners.spotlight: Two front-running wins this year, over C&D and 6f at Chelmsford, but only eighth of nine at Lingfield seven weeks ago and looks up against it now upped to a Class 4.

stable_tour.quote: He is a very consistent horse who always tries his best, which is backed up by his record of two wins, eight seconds and a handful of thirds. He is actually a hard horse to find races for at this time of the year as his best form is on the all-weather, hence he has a handicap mark 6lb higher on the artificial surfaces. We may try him on the grass again but I would prefer to run him on the all-weather. To my mind, he is a winner waiting to happen at the moment. 29-06-23

7:10.race_name: Unibet/British Stallion Studs EBF Fillies' Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands B/C/D) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Museum Piece
runners.owner: D Fish, Mrs F Mahony & Partner
runners.comment: Got her act together with clearcut win at Wolverhampton and she's respected under penalty
runners.spotlight: Well held at odds-on in three-runner Southwell maiden on debut early last month; beaten 14l at Beverley next time but she really got her act together when finishing well for a clearcut success at Wolverhampton (5f) last Monday; has a penalty but she's open to more progress on this step up in trip and is strongly respected.

runners.name: Jennifer Jane
runners.comment: 50,000euros yearling; has plenty of speed in pedigree and she needs watching in market
runners.spotlight: February foal; 50,000euros yearling; half-sister to winners Surpass And Shine (5f; RPR 78), Enkindle (Greek 5f-7f) and Black Angel (Polish 6f/7f including 2yo); dam 5f-7f winner (including 2yo; 101); has plenty of speed in pedigree and she needs watching in market on debut.

runners.name: Madame X
runners.owner: Pall Mall Partners & Black Type Ltd
runners.comment: Went close on recent Salisbury debut and she's in the mix on this step up in trip
runners.spotlight: Well-bred filly who was only narrowly denied in a small-field conditions event at Salisbury (5f, good to firm) 17 days ago; has a bit to find in this deeper race but that was a promising start and this step up in trip should suit on pedigree; in the mix.

runners.name: Mare Of London
runners.comment: Didn't show much on Ripon debut last month and can only be watched after that 16l defeat
runners.spotlight: Cost 40,000gns as a foal and yearling but she didn't show much on Ripon debut (last of five) last month and can only be watched after that 16l defeat.

runners.name: No Spritz No Party
runners.comment: Has good standard to aim at on debut and she could be a longer-term prospect
runners.spotlight: 5,000gns foal; sixth foal; half-sister to German 6f/6.5f winner Al Hitmi; dam 1m winner (including 2yo/AW/Qatar; RPR 83), half-sister to US 1m4f Grade 3 winner Ms Peintour; has good standard to aim at on debut and she could be a longer-term prospect.

runners.name: Resalah
runners.owner: Ahmad H Al Mutairi & Hicky Parmar Racing
runners.comment: Half-sister to six winners but yard yet to get off mark with 2yos this term; down the list
runners.spotlight: April foal; 37,000euros yearling, 42,000gns breeze-up 2yo; half-sister to six winners including Wobwobwob (6f/7f including 2yo; RPR 98), Honor Oak (6f-10.6f including AW; 94) and Hackman (Listed-placed 5f 2yo; 90); dam 5f-1m maiden (53); yard yet to get off the mark with 2yos this season and others are preferred.

runners.name: Sayidah Hard Spun
runners.comment: Promising fourth on Ascot debut and she's open to progress upped in trip; interesting
runners.spotlight: 62,000gns yearling; attracted support into 16-1 at Ascot (good to firm) two weeks ago and she made some good late headway to finish fourth of 13; that form puts her firmly in the picture and she's open to improvement upped in trip; interesting contender for yard that won this last year.

runners.name: Tobah
runners.comment: £60,000 half-sister to some useful winners; needs a close look on debut
runners.spotlight: 35,000gns foal, £60,000 yearling; sixth foal; half-sister to winners Yojaari (6f/7f including UAE dirt; RPR 89), Nehaall (7f/1m AW; 86) and Miqdaad (7f; 76); dam 7f AW winner (97), out of unraced half-sister to Musidora/Nassau winner Zahrat Dubai; plenty to like on paper and she needs a close look on debut.

runners.name: Cloudbuster
runners.comment: Well bred but she's drawn out wide and this looks a tough enough starting point
runners.spotlight: February foal; fifth foal; dam 6f winner (RPR 81), sister to 5f Group 2 winner Bated Breath, half-sister to 1m1f Group 1 winner Cityscape and 1m winner Scuffle (dam of St Leger winner Logician), out of 7f Listed winner; has striking pedigree but she's drawn  wide and this looks enough on debut.

runners.name: Coinin Caisc
runners.comment: Promising third at Bath and she should know more over this longer trip; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Ran green when 33-1 at Bath (good to firm) last month but she rallied to finish a clear third of nine; this is tougher on the switch to AW but she should know more this time and is a likely improver upped in trip; not ruled out.

runners.name: Mystic Moment
runners.comment: Has lots of stamina in pedigree and she could be one for longer trips later on
runners.spotlight: Second foal; half-sister to Qatari 8.5f winner Enchanted Eye; dam 1m/1m4f winner (including AW; RPR 80); has lots of stamina in  her pedigree and she could be one for longer trips later on.

6:40.race_name: Unibet More Extra Place Races Handicap (London Mile Series Qualifier)

runners.name: Bills Baar
runners.comment: Probably best watched on recovery mission/return to action
runners.spotlight: 0-7 in handicaps but went down by the narrowest margin at York last July; disappointing favourite in October and gelded ahead of this return to action; probably best watched from wide draw on AW debut (half-brother and dam did win on an artificial surface).

runners.name: A Major Payne
runners.comment: Excuses are starting to wear thin but a decent early pace should see him come into it late
runners.spotlight: Excuses are starting to wear thin for this maiden but he's almost certainly capable of scoring off this mark and a decent early pace would help; trainer still going great guns.

runners.name: Radiant Beauty
runners.comment: Finished weakly the last twice and bouncing back emerging from stall 14 won't be easy
runners.spotlight: This prominent racer is a dual AW winner (novice success came over C&D); finished weakly the last twice and bouncing back emerging from the widest stall won't be easy.

runners.name: Extrication
runners.comment: Pleasing return over 7f here a fortnight ago and has untapped potential for 1m
runners.spotlight: Yet to win but is lightly raced for a 6yo and ran some nice races last year; pleasing return over 7f here a fortnight ago and has untapped potential for 1m.

runners.name: City Of York
runners.comment: Should be all the better for his return and this C&D winner is well treated at present
runners.spotlight: First spin around Chelmsford off a 179-day break last month should have blown the cobwebs away and this C&D winner is well treated at present; can be fancied to arrive on the scene late; reared and unseated rider as stalls opened at Newmarket on Saturday (deemed a non-runner; sent off 16-1).

stable_tour.quote: He's ready to run. He enjoys a bit of juice in the ground and we've kept him on the all-weather. He's a really hard ride but he's more than capable. He should have a good autumn now. 04-09-24

runners.name: Arctician
runners.comment: Likely to show his true self this evening for all he may be vulnerable in the finish
runners.spotlight: A wide trip and him hanging left go a long way to explain a poor result here two weeks ago; likely to show his true self this evening for all he may be vulnerable in the finish (all wins have come over 7f).

runners.name: Hodler
runners.comment: Towards the foot of the list in trying to capitalise on a lower AW mark
runners.spotlight: Was having just his second start over 1m+ when running only okay at his favourite venue Epsom 29 days ago and he's towards the foot of the list in trying to capitalise on a lower AW mark here; trainer won this race last year.

quotes.race: Everyone's Turf Handicap
quotes.quote: We were delighted when it kept raining as Hodler is a different horse on this sort of ground, he quickens on it and picks up well. He could go to Epsom on Oaks or Derby day, there are races over seven furlongs and a mile and half a furlong. I just hope it keeps raining! - Jim Boyle, trainer.

quotes.race: Choose Dutemann Handicap
quotes.quote: Hodler is a nice horse and I've only sat on him three times and on all occasions he has won. He just got the ground he loves - Ryan Sexton, jockey.

runners.name: Monopolise
runners.comment: 3-4 over C&D and could put latest effort behind him if fully tuned up
runners.spotlight: Third C&D win from just four attempts came off 2lb lower in January and he was trapped wide when trailing in last over a shorter trip at this venue three weeks later; could easily bounce back if fully tuned up.

stable_tour.quote: He ran a bit free in front at Newmarket last week and he'd be better with some cover. But he's in good form overall and it was another solid run. 27-04-23

runners.name: Age Of Baroque
runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Haras Du Cadran Et Al
runners.comment: Second start for Marco Botti with Hollie Doyle taking over from 7lb claimer
runners.spotlight: Not easy to assess given he ran two nice races for Godolphin/Charlie Appleby before being moved on and twice finishing down the field at Meydan following over a year off the track; stable debut over C&D a fortnight ago didn't end well (he finished last) but there was a bit of money for him; interesting to see if the cash comes again with Hollie Doyle taking over from a 7lb claimer; hood discarded.

runners.name: Rhythm N Rock
runners.comment: Runner-up off 17lb higher in this race last year (it was a 0-85 then); well out of sorts
runners.spotlight: Runner-up off 17lb higher in this race last year (when a 0-85) but precious little to shout about since; leap of faith required to support.

runners.name: Royal Pleasure
runners.comment: Form chance on last-time-out second but isn't one for maximum faith
runners.spotlight: Mainly sprinting for previous yard; having just his second run for Karen Jewell when going down by a neck over 1m at Lingfield last month; form chance but isn't one for maximum faith.

runners.name: Tex
runners.comment: Yard could hardly be in better form and he's a handicap debutant to note
runners.spotlight: Easily brushed aside by previous and subsequent winner who was sent off 1-14 here last time (7f) but that was the best of his three novice runs in 2024; yard could hardly be in better form and he's a handicap debutant to note.

runners.name: Charencey
runners.comment: Looks one for another day (probably over a furlong shorter on turf)
runners.spotlight: Two wins last year (one was a dead-heat) came over 7f on turf; yet to really get going this time around, for all he wasn't seen to best effect last time; others more at home under these conditions.

runners.name: Law Supreme
runners.comment: Chance, for all he might not come on bundles for C&D return two weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Made the frame on C&D return two weeks ago but isn't sure to come on bundles for that given his sole win for the yard came off a short break; still, he has a chance.

5:05.race_name: Unibet Support Safer Gambling Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands B/C/D) (GBB Race) (Div I)

runners.name: Believe The Storm
runners.comment: Form of debut win not up to much but it was pleasing on the eye
runners.spotlight: Form of debut win at Wolverhampton last December (7f) isn't up to much but he was out of his ground turning in and produced a strong late burst; carries 7lb penalty and the 3yos are in receipt of 11lb here; more to do but not ruled out.

runners.name: Analytical Engine
runners.comment: Twice well beaten at three; undergone wind surgery/starts out for new yard as 4yo
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in two runs over this trip at Chelmsford for John Gallagher as a 3yo last year; can only watch starting out for new yard having undergone wind surgery.

runners.name: Dannick
runners.comment: Eyecatcher on nursery debut and gelded since; this more galloping track might suit better
runners.spotlight: Achieved a similar amount in RPR terms last three starts, most recently when doing some good late work after completely blowing the start on nursery debut at Lingfield in December (7f); gelded since; this more galloping track might suit better and he has a squeak.

runners.name: Karthala
runners.comment: Just 16 days has passed since looking in need of the experience on debut (finished fifth)
runners.spotlight: This half-brother to five winners showed only minor promise on debut at Windsor (1m, good to firm; 9-1) but looked in need of the experience; just 16 days has passed and he might need a bit more time; drawn widest.

runners.name: Yielding To None
runners.owner: Mrs Heather Ann Chakko And Simon Dow
runners.comment: Failed to beat a rival on last month's handicap debut and has the lowest BHA mark
runners.spotlight: Failed to beat a rival on last month's handicap debut (when upped to 1m2f) and has the lowest BHA mark of the four to have one; look elsewhere.

runners.name: Ashen
runners.comment: Another positive showing is on the cards for all he's drawn wide again
runners.spotlight: Just about his best run when fifth of nine on handicap debut here 16 days ago (1m) and that run can be marked up a bit due to his wide trip; draw again hasn't been kind but positive showing is on the cards.

runners.name: Brize Norton
runners.comment: Looks the one to be on with rail draw a bonus
runners.spotlight: Improver in placing and RPR terms at two with his last-time-out third at Salisbury reading well (winner/stablemate finished fifth in 1,000 Guineas and two of his other three rivals won either next time or the time after); gelded since; this looks a good opportunity; rail draw.

runners.name: Maximising
runners.breeder: Ballybin Stud Ltd & Patrick F Kelly
runners.comment: Closely related to three winners with RPRs of 90-105, half-brother to four more
runners.spotlight: 49,000euros foal; tenth foal; closely related to three winners with RPRs of 90-105, half-brother to four more; dam French Listed-placed 1m1f 2yo winner; likely type on paper; trainer around 11% in maiden/novice contests; already gelded.

runners.name: Marmalade Kid
runners.comment: 16-1 for five-runner Salisbury contest when withdrawn on vet's advice this month
runners.spotlight: Seventh foal; brother to 1m 2yo AW winner American Tale (RPR 69), half-brother to 6f/7f AW winner Tell'em Nowt (71); dam placed 6.5f/7f AW (72); already gelded; 16-1 for five-runner Salisbury contest when withdrawn on vet's advice this month; market can guide.

runners.name: Read All About It
runners.comment: Should step forward from debut effort, but good stride likely needed
runners.spotlight: Late headway into fourth in the slower division of a C&D maiden on debut two weeks ago (10-1); should improve, but needs to.

runners.name: Ribenska
runners.comment: Could build on promising debut but 7f and Shoemark riding the top one are negatives
runners.spotlight: Fared best of the newcomers and came from the rear in a race where it paid to be handy when fourth on debut here in December (33-1); dropping back a furlong doesn't look an obvious move, and Kieran Shoemark seemingly prefers Believe The Storm, but she can't be ruled out.

runners.name: Apple Of My Eye
runners.comment: Trainer not noted for having winners in maiden/novice contests; probably best watched
runners.spotlight: 2,600gns yearling; first foal; dam unraced; trainer not noted for having winners in maiden/novice contests; probably best watched.

runners.name: Havanita
runners.owner: Mrs R Lyon & P R Chamings
runners.comment: Trainer 0-48 in novice contests (he operates at around 5% in maidens)
runners.spotlight: 15,000gns yearling; fourth foal; half-sister to winners Zebelle (5f 2yo; RPR 80) and Decanter (Czech 1m4f); dam unraced; trainer 0-48 in novice contests (he operates at around 5% in maidens); others appeal more.

runners.name: Kittens Gift
runners.comment: Trainer operates at around 6% in maiden/novice contests; probably one for another day
runners.spotlight: 11,000gns yearling; fifth foal; closely related to 7f AW winner Ribal (RPR 81), half-sister to French 7f winner Sicilian Defense (including Listed; 108); dam French Listed-placed 7.5f AW 2yo winner (102); trainer operates at around 6% in maiden/novice contests; probably one for another day.

runners.name: Aikhal

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Mary Slack And Mrs J Slack Jell

runners.comment: Close up over 9.4f latest and that trip was on the short side for one with form over 1m6f
runners.spotlight: Group class for Aidan O'Brien but those days have long gone and he's 2-30 overall; however, it was a good run with the blinkers back on at Wolverhampton (9.4f) and that trip was on the short side for one with form over 1m6f.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Aikhal had the pace to get a proper position and he handles a dig. He will need to improve but he probably will - Seamie Heffernan, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He went to France last year and wasn't beaten far in a Group 1 race, so we were thinking he might be one to go the St Mark's Basilica route, the Poulains and the Prix du Jockey Club. He has worked very well. We think he's potentially a Classic-standard colt anyway, so the Irish 2,000 Guineas would be a possibility too. The Tetrarch Stakes has gone up to a mile from seven furlongs this year, so that could be a starting-off point for him. 19-04-22

runners.name: Dorset Lady
runners.comment: No form, Flat or hurdles, for current yard; wind op needs to turn things around
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish maiden, mostly in bumpers; no form, Flat or hurdles, for current yard; wind op needs to turn things around.

runners.name: Apache Canyon
runners.comment: Won over 1m3f at Southwell in October but has offered precious little since then
runners.spotlight: Won over 1m3f at Southwell in October but has offered precious little since then, including when tailed off on yard debut.

runners.name: One Million Dreams

prev_owners.owner: Paul Deavin, Gerald Chesneau Et Al

runners.comment: Minor form under both codes but Hollie Doyle is booked for handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Limited maiden hurdler and hasn't offered a lot in three Flat starts; however, he's in a shrewd yard and Hollie Doyle is booked for handicap debut.

runners.name: Cloudside Rock
runners.comment: Lightly raced; close up over 1m4f two runs back and 1m6f perhaps a stretch last time
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced; only 3l away over this far at Wolverhampton before not appearing to get home over 1m6f there; could go well.

runners.name: Autumns Breeze
runners.comment: Best run yet was her 2nd at Yarmouth, having previously been 0-4 here; off since October
runners.spotlight: First four races were here and offered little on handicap debut over 1m3f; however, raised her game on turf debut at Yarmouth (extended 1m3f, soft) when emerging from well off the pace to finish second; now has to transfer that back to the AW and she's been off since October.

runners.name: Lawn Ranger
runners.comment: Usually saves his best for Windsor and this 10yo's powers would appear to be on the wane
runners.spotlight: Usually saves his best for Windsor and this 10yo's powers would appear to be on the wane; opposable on this return from a break.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing On Sky 415 Handicap
quotes.quote: Lawn Ranger hasn't won since the first race of his life but he is a big baby and when he is out in front he doesn't do a lot. He stayed on well and it is nice to see him win again - Michael Attwater, trainer.

quotes.race: 32Red.com Novice Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: Lawn Ranger was only four grand, but we liked the dam, who was tough. He kept on growing and is a big, tall horse, so we had to take out time. He's a big, long striding horse and  missed the break. I'm surprised at how well he came home. He can only get better - Mick Attwater, trainer.

runners.name: Starfighter
runners.comment: Capable on his day but Wolverhampton is very much his scene and he's 0-6 here
runners.spotlight: Most effective when getting a solid pace to chase but Wolverhampton is very much his scene and he's 0-6 here.

quotes.race: Heed Your Hunch At Betway Handicap
quotes.quote: Starfighter has been a slow burner since he joined us from Ed Walker's and it's just taken a bit of time to get him right. He was rated higher a few years back so hopefully there's bit more improvement there and he'll go on the turf - Mark Loughnane, trainer.

quotes.race: Lester Brunt Wealth Management Handicap
quotes.quote: Starfighter deserved that he had been frustrating really. He has never really done much wrong, maybe he had been hitting the front a bit early or not quite getting home. Today he went through to the line and there was no doubting his temperament. He could step forward now - Ed Walker, trainer.

runners.name: Sneaky Blinder
runners.breeder: Al Shaqab Racing & S C E A Des Prairies
runners.comment: Proven here and ran okay last week at Bath in a race that wasn't run to suit
runners.spotlight: Won twice here in January, a 1m3f classified and C&D handicap; ran okay last week at Bath when held up in a modestly-run race; could go well.

runners.name: Gold Souk

prev_owners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Al Maktoum

runners.comment: Respected on old form but finished right out the back in both races after a long absence
runners.spotlight: Respected on old form but has finished right out the back in both races after a long absence.

quotes.race: Novibet Handicap
quotes.quote: Gold Souk had been missing the break but the cheekpieces have helped today and he was just dossing a bit when he hit the front - Joshua Bryan, jockey.

runners.name: Tatmeen
runners.comment: Improved 2nd over 1m on handicap debut; there are 1m4f winners in the family
runners.spotlight: Didn't go unbacked when showing improvement on handicap debut at Lingfield (1m, AW) where he responded well for early pressure to chase home an in-form favourite; this is a big hike in distance but there are 1m4f winners in the family.

runners.name: Good Eye
runners.owner: The Upt North Darn South Syndicate
runners.comment: 50-1 for handicap debut at Pontefract (1m) and was never involved after starting slowly
runners.spotlight: Went off 50-1 for handicap debut at Pontefract (1m) and was never involved after starting slowly; tries cheekpieces.

runners.name: Marinakis
runners.comment: Consistent on the AW this year and didn't get the breaks when upped to 1m4f last time
runners.spotlight: Consistent run of form on the AW this year and didn't get the breaks when upped to 1m4f last time; 1-1 in cheekpieces and those aids now return.

quotes.race: Weekly £5 Free Bet With BetUK Classified Stakes (Div I)
quotes.quote: I had to wait [to get a run] but it probably did me a favour, I hit the front a little bit sooner on Marinakis the last day. The cheekpieces definitely helped him but he did it well - Billy Loughnane, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Cornish Storm
runners.comment: Competitive under both codes this year and he's a C&D winner
runners.spotlight: Won a maiden hurdle earlier this year and was a respectable third at Bath in April (1m6f, good to firm); has to bounce back from a below-par run over hurdles but this C&D winner is not dismissed.

6:10.race_name: Unibet 40,000+ Live Streamed Events Handicap (London Mile Series Qualifier)

runners.name: Bizou
runners.comment: Should find openings at 1m if settling better than on return; mark probably about right.
runners.spotlight: Initial refusal to settle found her out on last month's Windsor return rather than the step up to 1m (good to firm; beaten 10l); initial mark looks about right if last year's Salisbury Class 2 run is taken as gospel.

runners.name: Turpin
runners.comment: Likely attainment level in handicaps not yet clear; some form here, albeit over 7f.
runners.spotlight: Likely attainment level in handicaps not easily determined from last month's Epsom run (wouldn't settle; hung off home bend); wind surgery since, and now returns to scene of best novice/maiden effort (albeit over 7f).

runners.name: Bintshuaa
runners.comment: Mark unchanged from recent C&D handicap/stable debut third, when drawn further out.
runners.spotlight: Disputed lead appeared more the issue than the step up from sprint trips when just over 1l third on this month's C&D handicap/stable debut (English Lady sixth); mark unchanged, and slightly better drawn tonight.

runners.name: Opening Bat
runners.owner: Mrs R J Mccreery And Richard Craddock
runners.comment: 1l fourth on Bath handicap/seasonal debut latest (1m) despite racing freely; shortlisted.
runners.spotlight: Too free on return from four months out at Bath last month (1m, good to firm), but his 1l fourth still represented a clear personal best; easier task than on sole previous Polytrack start (Class 3 novice).

runners.name: Le Pelerin
runners.comment: Better than bare form of recent Wolverhampton sixth (denied a run); stiff opening mark.
runners.spotlight: Not yet done with when hitting traffic at Wolverhampton latest (7f; beaten 10l); that effort can be marked up and it was his best to date, but likely another big leap forward required to defy a stiff opening mark.

runners.name: Beta Reader
runners.comment: Got up on the line to win on handicap debut in March (7f); probable stayer of further.
runners.spotlight: Got up on the line from an unpromising position on March's Wolverhampton handicap debut (7f), and maybe best excused a moderate follow-up effort back there after spending too long on the outer; some encouragement for 1m on breeding, for all that the dam was a winning sprinter.

runners.name: Kebili
runners.comment: 1m ought to have suited, but didn't offer much on last month's seasonal/handicap debut.
runners.spotlight: 1m trip should have suited on breeding, so have to hope last month's anonymous Nottingham eleventh on seasonal/handicap debut was simply needed; not the appeal of some despite a 3lb drop.

runners.name: A La Louche
runners.comment: Initial mark not a gift on previous form, but 1m likelier to be within her range; player.
runners.spotlight: Not obviously well treated on the basis of her efforts in 6f-7f novice/maiden class last autumn, but betrayed inexperience at least once; new trip likelier to be in range, and a threat to all if more mature now.

runners.name: Tiempo Alegre
runners.comment: Most experienced here; 3lb above her winning mark, and needs everything to fall right.
runners.spotlight: Last-gasp Southwell scorer in December (7f) but frequently a hostage to fortune with her hold-up race style and hasn't faced this many rivals since her debut 12 runs ago; 3lb above that winning mark.

runners.name: English Lady
runners.comment: 7f Polytrack debut winner in November, but less persuasive over tonight's trip since.
runners.spotlight: Hasn't gone on from November's 33-1 Chelmsford debut success (7f), failing again to convince over 1m when three places and over 3l behind Bintshuaa over this C&D latest; further 2lb drop isn't persuasive.

runners.name: Letsbeatsepsis
runners.comment: Ostensibly regressive, but this is much easier than either previous 2025 run; interesting.
runners.spotlight: RPRs continue to paint a regressive profile, but this is appreciably easier than the Class 4s of either 2025 start and his dam landed her sole 1m score over this C&D; not without interest; blinkers go on.

runners.name: Champagne Belle
runners.comment: 7f again appeared an inadequate test last time (here); realistic-looking opening mark.
runners.spotlight: One-paced when it mattered over 7f here back in February; sensible on that basis to return to the trip of her best effort to date, on which piece of form she looks realistically treated for handicaps, too.

runners.name: Take The Boat
runners.comment: 3-3 in handicaps here (one C&D); nothing went right early on latest; mark unchanged.
runners.spotlight: 3-3 in handicaps here (one C&D) under Rob Hornby, who partners Bizou instead; latest effort necessarily ignored (hampered and stumbled early) and this should reveal more as to whether the assessor is now on top.

runners.name: Frostmagic
runners.comment: Doncaster 1m2f winner latest on first run since gelding operation; drawn widest again.
runners.spotlight: Game Doncaster scorer latest, the improvement presumably attributed to the gelding operation rather than the 1m2f considering this immediate drop back in trip; 3lb rise tolerable, but drawn widest again.

5:40.race_name: Unibet Support Safer Gambling Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands B/C/D) (GBB Race) (Div II)

runners.name: Cosi Bello
runners.comment: Solid debut win and he's respected under a 7lb penalty
runners.spotlight: Steadily supported ahead of last month's debut at Chelmsford (7f) and he came through to win nicely in the end; the second and third have boosted the form a smidge since and he's respected under a 7lb penalty from a handy draw.

runners.name: American State
runners.comment: Might need stepping up to 1m but at least this more-galloping 7f will help
runners.spotlight: Showed improved form each start and narrowly failed to catch Arboreous for second at Chelmsford last time; is probably ready for a step up to 1m but at least this more-galloping 7f will help.

runners.name: Arboreous
runners.comment: Left debut effort well behind 27 days ago; highly competitive if building on that
runners.spotlight: Left debut effort well behind when finding just a stablemate too strong at Chelmsford 27 days ago (7f; challenged up the far rail); another good step forward should see him highly competitive; drawn wide.

runners.name: Moonlight Bomb
runners.comment: Looks a longer-term prospect based on debut effort
runners.spotlight: Ran around a bit on debut at Windsor last month and showed only minor promise (1m, good to firm; 22-1); looks a longer-term prospect.

runners.name: Moyowasi
runners.comment: Looked badly in need of the experience on debut; surely needs more time
runners.spotlight: Sent off 40-1 and looked badly in need of the experience when down the field at Doncaster last month (7f, good to firm); this half-brother to Cicero's Gift surely needs more time.

runners.name: Deira Storm
runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Haras Du Cadran Et Al
runners.comment: Key player having shaped best sole start
runners.spotlight: Shaped best on debut at Wolverhampton in December, coming from an unpromising position and having to weave a passage before grabbing second (7f; 7-1); form is okay (first, third and fourth have at least won since) and he should improve; key player.

runners.name: Wrydcroft
runners.breeder: M H Sly & Mrs P M Sly
runners.owner: G Libson And Mrs P Sly
runners.comment: Rare runner for trainer in AW novice but she's had some success in maidens
runners.spotlight: Second foal; half-brother to 6f winner Torfrida (RPR 77); dam 1m2f winner (83); already gelded; rare runner for trainer in AW novice but she's had some success in maidens; probably best watched.

runners.name: Uppercase
runners.comment: Will need to step up on 2yo form if he's to trouble a couple of these
runners.spotlight: Similar form when third in 7f maidens here and at Wolverhampton last year; will need to step up if he's to trouble a couple of these.

runners.name: Moderna
runners.comment: Trainer has a nice 3yo or two and she needs monitoring in the market
runners.spotlight: 65,000euros yearling; fifth foal; half-sister to four winners, one achieved RPR of 98; dam 1m AW winner (88); trainer has a nice 3yo or two and she needs monitoring in the market.

runners.name: Lilac Wine
runners.comment: Low-key start over C&D last month but she battled greenness throughout
runners.spotlight: Low-key start over C&D last month but she battled greenness throughout (33-1); today may not be her day.

runners.name: Sansanetti
runners.comment: Trainer does well with new recruits but she's surely one for handicaps after this
runners.spotlight: Didn't achieve much in two starts for Dylan Cunha last year; trainer does well with new recruits but she's surely one for handicaps after this.

runners.name: Lady Monroe
runners.comment: Reportedly lost her action when tailed off sole start at two
runners.spotlight: Reportedly lost her action when tailed off sole start at two (6f, Wolverhampton; 66-1); can't consider.

runners.name: Queen Cody
runners.comment: Unlikely to come into her own until tackling handicaps over 1m+
runners.spotlight: Twice soundly beaten when sent off just 4-1 and will probably come into her own in handicaps over 1m+; drawn widest.

3:55.race_name: DragonBet Born From The Betting Ring Handicap
3:55.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.2) (Watering)

runners.name: Glamorous Breeze
runners.comment: Capable sprinter and not impossibly treated, though record when fresh is offputting
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner and only 3lb higher than for September's win at Bath (5f, good) which was fairly convincing; record fresh is none too convincing, however.

quotes.race: S H Jones Wines Handicap
quotes.quote: Glamorous Breeze is just quirky. She's got plenty of ability and was second in a Listed race last season. This year I figured her out, sit, hold still then [go] last 50 yards. It's not she's ungenuine, she just does enough - William Cox, jockey.

runners.name: Jacquelina
runners.comment: Signs were a lot more encouraging when not far away at Newmarket at the weekend
runners.spotlight: Won five times in six races last summer but lost her way in the autumn; however, the signs were a lot more encouraging when not far away at Newmarket at the weekend (5f, good to firm).

quotes.race: Trade Centre UK Handicap
quotes.quote: I can't believe the amount Jacquelina has improved. It's kind of by default that she has because she ran on the heavy ground at Windsor and we didn't think she'd like it, but since she's run on soft ground she's just improved. To go and win like that today under a double penalty was pretty impressive. I wake up at about 8st 6lb and this saddle is about 2st! She's got an entry at Hamilton on Thursday but there's also a couple of options at Thirsk for her - Grace McEntee, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Rosenpur
runners.comment: Has only won on the AW but he was collared only late on at Chester (5f, good)
runners.spotlight: Has only won on the AW but he was collared only late on at Chester (5f, good) after racing prominently from a good draw; consistent and should go well again.

quotes.race: CAA Stellar Handicap
quotes.quote: Rosenpur ran really well. He jumped the gates better than expected, took the lead and travelled beautifully. He stayed on all the way to the line, you couldn't fault him one bit. He'll come on a lot for that, getting back on the grass, and he should be winning soon - Warren Fentiman, jockey.

runners.name: Ecclesiastical
runners.comment: Went up 7lb for his win in March and failed to figure next time; new trainer
runners.spotlight: Comfortably saw off six rivals at Lingfield (5f AW) in March but went up 7lb for that and then failed to figure at Wolverhampton; this is first run since leaving Tristan Davidson.

quotes.race: Winter Series Awards At Dundalk Stadium Handicap
quotes.quote: Ecclesiastical has been a very consistent horse and had a good solid run the last day, he deserved that. He went a bit left so he's probably worth a little bit more than how far he won - Colin Keane, rider

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: I thought Eccliastical would have won long before now, he always showed us plenty at home. Maybe gelding him has helped. Colin said he was probably in front soon enough and he'd rather have been there a bit later - Tom McCourt, trainer

runners.name: Phoenix Beach
runners.comment: Excuses two runs back and went off a bit too fast when returned to 6f last time
runners.spotlight: The winner of six races on the AW and, although 0-12 on turf, he has placed form on this surface; had excuses two runs back and went off a bit too fast when returned to 6f last time.

runners.name: Connies Rose
runners.comment: Best of three runs after wind surgery was last week's very close third here over 6f
runners.spotlight: Best of three runs after wind surgery was last week's very close third here over 6f; she's back on a good mark and plenty quick enough for 5f; goes well here.

I'm still undecided if she prefers 5f.  We thought she was going to be a 1m-plus horse as she was slow, green and didn't know how to gallop at all, but she got a lot quicker at home.  Would we get more improvement holding her up at 1m?  We don't know.  We may try it in future but we don't want to change anything that's working at the moment - Grace Harris, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Visit attheraces.com Handicap
quotes.quote: I'd love a yard full of horses like Garden Oasis, he's wonderful. He's very uncomplicated, the more you complicate it the worse he runs. He's tough, he likes it here and he goes on pretty much any ground - Tim Easterby, trainer.

quotes.race: Visit attheraces.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Every time Garden Oasis ran last season he came back not right. He was actually in the sales but we decided not to sell him. It took a long time to get him right in the winter but he's been sound and okay recently and ran a good race at Haydock but just didn't get home. David won it in the first furlong - Tim Easterby, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran a bit disappointingly at Ripon, where he just didn't fire for some reason, but he's come out of that well. A mile is his trip, on good ground. 02-05-22

For a horse who needs the race to be run at an end-to-end gallop he did not enjoy proceedings on Town Moor as they crawled most of the way before it developed into a sprint, so all things considered it was a fine effort. Both of his runs for me have been over 7f but I am trying him over a mile at Carlisle on Wednesday. His current mark of 73 is very fair and I would be very hopeful of him winning before long. 22-06-22

quotes.quote: Glasses Up is just getting better and better and in time I'm sure he will step up to one and a half miles. His target is the Kilkerran Cup at the Gold Cup meeting - Mike Smith, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a super horse. When I bought him at the sales I was told I could spend £8k, maybe £10k at a push, and I rang the boys up and said, “I'm going to have to go to full budget for this.” The boys said, “Mike, that's a lot of money for a horse who hasn't run”, and I said “yes, but he's a cracking horse.” He was actually bought with an entry for the Derby. He's now won eight races for us and £121k in prize-money, so it was money well spent. The boys have turned down fairly good offers for him because they wanted to keep racing and having fun with him, which is commendable. He was a good third on his seasonal reappearance at Ayr behind Fiver Friday. He benefited from a racecourse gallop on the track after the Scottish National meeting, which is a fantastic thing and I think that's one of the reasons the Irish horses do so well. 16-05-24

runners.name: Sophiesticate
runners.comment: C&D winner but well beaten over C&D last month when back from a long absence
runners.spotlight: C&D winner who is well handicapped on course form as recent as August 2023, but she was well beaten over C&D last month when back from a long absence and needs to be an entirely different proposition today.

stable_tour.quote: She's a progressive filly who has won over 1m2f and 1m4f this season and is still on the upgrade. She's out of a Galileo mare from a very good family, of which the granny was the best. She's up to a mark of 71 and I expect more progress. 12-09-22

2:30.race_name: Racing TV Profits Returned To Racing Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
2:30.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (Watering)

runners.name: Kanishka
runners.owner: C Booth, P Boyle, S Coleby & S Smith
runners.comment: Promising fourth on both starts; has limitations but the step up to 6f is a likely plus
runners.spotlight: Promising run in the Brocklesby (5f, good to soft) in March and again finished fourth at Beverley (5f, good) last month; vulnerable if bumping into anything useful but the step up to 6f is a likely plus; can run well.

runners.name: Strength Of Spirit
runners.owner: Hambleton Racing Xlviii & Mrs E Burke
runners.comment: Half-brother to useful 2yo winner and from top northern yard; could have big say on debut
runners.spotlight: 23,000euros foal, 50,000euros yearling; third foal; Ulysses half-brother to 7f 2yo winner Boyfriend (RPR 92); dam 6f/7f 2yo winner (81) from classy family; from top northern yard and could have a big say on debut.

runners.name: Sudbury Hill
runners.comment: Attractive pedigree and Newmarket trainer is 3-8 with 2yos here; interesting newcomer
runners.spotlight: 37,000euros foal, 62,000euros yearling; ninth foal; Cotai Glory half-brother to five winners including Champers Elysees (6f-1m including 2yo/Group 1), Daddies Girl (5f-1m including 2yo; RPR 96) and Elzem (6f 2yo; 81); Newmarket trainer is 3-8 with 2yos here; interesting newcomer.

runners.name: Sunny Smile
runners.comment: 78,000gns yearling from talented family and trainer can ready one first time
runners.spotlight: 78,000gns yearling; second foal; half-brother to US 5.5f/7f turf winner Chardy Party (including Grade 3); dam 6f 2yo Listed winner; wears a tongue-tie; stable can ready one first time and he's a possible player.

runners.name: Underwriter
runners.breeder: Ecurie Haras De Saint Vincent Et Al
runners.comment: Newcomer; £200,000 2yo breeze-ups; Lambourn trainer 4-9 with 2yos here in last five years
runners.spotlight: £200,000 2yo breeze-ups; by Mehmas; second foal; dam unplaced, half-sister to winners Fas (French 6f Group 3) and Silva (French 1m1f Group 3), out of Listed-placed 5f 2yo winning half-sister to multiple 5f Group 1 winner Sole Power; Lambourn trainer 4-9 with 2yos here in last five years; firmly in calculations on debut.

runners.name: Saxon Gem
runners.owner: The Vital Sparks & David D Smith
runners.comment: Trainer in fine form and has done well with her family but she may be one for later on
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; Saxon Warrior half-sister to three winners for the yard, including Lord Of The Glen (multiple 5f including 2yo; RPR 80); stable is in fine form but she may be one for further down the line.

runners.name: Whisperwood
runners.comment: Held in 4th on debut but she should be able to take a sizeable step forward at some stage
runners.spotlight: Sent off favourite when fourth of ten, beaten about 5l, on debut at Southwell (5f, AW) three weeks ago; considerable improvement is needed today but this 115,000euros half-sister to the useful Hebrides should take a sizeable step forward at some stage.

2:00.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (Watering)

runners.name: Le Beau Garcon
runners.breeder: Mrs S Field, Miss S Field & Mr A Turbitt
runners.comment: Fair mark for his reappearance and he has gone well fresh in the past; one to consider
runners.spotlight: Can go well fresh and he returns from a 253-day absence off a mark just 1lb higher than when beating 11 rivals at Thirsk last summer; one to consider.

runners.name: Copper Knight
runners.comment: Two promising runs this year; down to Class 5 for the first time; should make a bold bid
runners.spotlight: Veteran sprinter who dips his toe into Class 5 waters for the first time on his 105th start; he's run well twice this year, fourth of 12 at Chester (Class 2) two weeks ago; slower ground probably ideal these days but he's still likely to make a bold bid.

quotes.race: Irish Thoroughbred Marketing Handicap
quotes.quote: Copper Knight is a wonderful little horse and tries like hell. He just loves it here and a bit of juice in the ground - Tim Easterby, trainer.

quotes.race: Edinburgh Gin Rhubarb & Ginger Handicap
quotes.quote: It's unbelievable and I'm not sure how Copper Knight keeps showing up and putting in these amazing performances. He started the season quite high in the handicap and needed to come down a few pounds, but he's still full of it and we'll keep going back to York as he absolutely loves it there - Tom Denham, part-owner.

quotes.race: Sky Bet And Symphony Group Handicap
quotes.quote: Copper Knight is a super horse and wonderful to train. Dave (Allan) said he'd not felt as good as that in a long time. He loves good ground and coasting along. He trains himself really, he just lobs away at the back and we don't do anything fancy with him. He gets himself ready and is an absolute star. We may look at the Portland at Doncaster - Tim Easterby, trainer.

quotes.race: Matchbook Betting Exchange Handicap
quotes.quote: Copper Knight is a star. He ran great first time out last year then he went up 7lb, that snookered him and he went off the boil so he got himself re-handicapped.   He ran well at Chester last week and they dropped him 1lb for being third but he likes it here. He was just cocking his lugs a bit but he was always going to hold on.   We might run him in the Dash at Epsom - Tim Easterby, trainer.

quotes.race: John Smith's City Walls Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Copper Knight is a lovely horse, he's been an absolute star for us and he's better than ever. Ideally he'd wants a bit more juice in the ground but he copes with anything. He's in the King George Stakes at Goodwood and he'll probably go there and he could come back here for the Nunthorpe - Tim Easterby, trainer.

quotes.race: Matchbook Betting Exchange Handicap
quotes.quote: Copper Knight is a wonderful horse, he's one of those that tries, he wants to win races. I'd rather have been drawn low because I think the high stalls had a disadvantage but he ran great. He's a super little horse and he'll go to Epsom for the Dash. Eeh Bah Gum will go too, he ran well but he wasn't drawn where the pace was - Tim Easterby, trainer.

quotes.race: Lady Cecil Handicap
quotes.quote: I rode Copper Knight last time at Doncaster and he ran a really good race. Today the race worked out perfectly for him. He wants a strong pace and when the gaps opened he took them - Paul Hanagan, rider.

quotes.race: Parsonage Hotel And Cloisters Spa Handicap
quotes.quote: Copper Knight was niggled a bit early on so they must have been going fast. He likes a bit of ease in the ground - Tim Easterby, trainer.

quotes.race: Stobart Energy Gosforth Park Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Copper Knight is pretty uncomplicated. He just jumps fast. He seemed to be really enjoying himself in front, he felt like he was at half pace - I was ahead of some quick horses but he felt like he was doing it easily. I fancied him quite a lot for the Scottish Sprint last time but I think he probably just still needed the run to put the fitness on him - David Allan, jockey.

quotes.race: Unibet Sprint Stakes (Handicap)
quotes.quote: Copper Knight isn't very big but he's very quick. He could be a Listed performer - Keith Stone, trainer's representative.

quotes.race: Sustainable Group (UK) Ltd Handicap
quotes.quote: Copper Knight ran a good race at Ripon last month. He's won round Chester before and seems to be getting faster - Anthony Denham, part-owner.

quotes.race: Stellar Group Lily Agnes Conditions Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: We were hopeful at Windsor, but Copper Knight ran into one of Richard Hannon's. We entered him just to see what would turn up against him and luckily the ground dried a bit and the race could have been stronger, though it wasn't weak. Royal Ascot would be the dream, but we'll have to see - George Boughey, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He looks great and you'd never know he was ten years old. He'll go back to York for the Dante meeting. He's won seven times there - some hate the track but he loves it. 23-04-24

runners.name: Eternal Sunshine
runners.comment: Five wins in 2024; ran her best race in 2025 last month; major player off same mark
runners.spotlight: Progressive last year, winning five times (three of them at Ayr, the latest over this trip), and she ran her best race of this campaign when a close third of 12 at Musselburgh last month; runs off the same mark today and looks a major player.

stable_tour.quote: She's had a really good season, winning five times. It was frustrating to get beat last time when she got hampered in the Ayr Bronze Cup. She's a homebred and we purposely let her mature. I still think there's improvement in her but we've decided that was enough for the season. Hopefully she'll come back off a nice mark next year and we'll look to follow in the footsteps of American Affair. 02-10-24

runners.name: Nelson Gay
runners.comment: Made all over C&D three weeks ago; more needed to defy his 3lb rise
runners.spotlight: Three wins this year, the latest when making all over C&D three weeks ago (good to firm); up 3lb and might not get things his own way up front this time.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: I felt justified running Nelson Gay in the Norfolk last season after he was beaten at Yarmouth, but it just didn't happen for him last year until he fell in in a bad maiden at Southwell. He won well at Wolverhampton last time, which was the first stepping stone to better things and he was very good. I didn't expect him to win eight lengths, but he's in a race at Goodwood next week or we'll go for the five-furlong handicap at Royal Ascot - Richard Hughes, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well at Wolverhampton last time when runner-up to Phoenix Beach. There probably weren't enough runners for him - it's better if he runs into a bit of trouble. A furlong out it looked like he had the beating of the winner but he just hesitated. I'd be half tempted to put a set of blinkers on him next time. He seems to like the all-weather but I'm not sure where we'll go next. 28-08-24

runners.name: Classy Al
runners.comment: Well backed when winning this race last year; Paul Mulrennan on Eternal Sunshine this time
runners.spotlight: Well backed when winning the corresponding race 12 months ago off a 2lb higher mark; Paul Mulrennan on board Eternal Sunshine this time and his two runs this year leave him with something to prove.

stable_tour.quote: He's a bairn I know well as I trained his dam and granny, but he hasn't been easy to train. First time out this year he dropped Paul Mulrennan going to the start but, despite his quirks, he has an engine. I have an idea to run him on the all-weather to change the script a little. He's in grand form at home and we'll look at the 5f and 7f handicaps next week at Ayr. 12-09-22

runners.name: Pockley
runners.owner: William Burns & Miss L A Perratt
runners.comment: Three Class 6 AW wins this year but he's 0-31 on turf and others look stronger
runners.spotlight: Three Class 6 wins on the AW this year; 0-31 on turf, however, and others look stronger in today's field.

5:17.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (Watering)

runners.name: Jewel Maker
runners.comment: 10yo; 1lb above his last winning mark, from November, having been below form this season
runners.spotlight: 10yo who's had ten wins, the latest over 1m last July/November; he's back 1lb above his last winning mark but needs to step up a couple of gears following his three runs this year; it was on fifth start that he got competitive again last season but this is a weak race; 7lb claimer is recruited.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Sunday Series Middle Distance Handicap
quotes.quote: This was a stronger race than Jewel Maker won at Carlisle and he picked them up nicely. He's a horse who needs cover early on as he can be a bit keen  - Sean Kirrane, jockey.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Jewel Maker will appreciate much better ground and he's a colt we would expect to get black type with in the coming weeks over 7f to a mile. He's a good-actioned horse and he will come on considerably - Dermot Weld, trainer.

runners.name: Beltane
runners.comment: No win since June 2023 but had his share of places, including last two runs; cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Can make the running; winless since June 2023 but he's had his share of place returns over the last year, including over 7f/1m on last two outings; visored twice, including penultimate start, and now tries cheekpieces; player if they don't have an adverse effect.

runners.name: Circles
runners.comment: Four 7f AW wins; yet to register anything significant in 5 turf races but hampered latest
runners.spotlight: Irish runner; gained a fourth 7f AW win in March; dropping back to 6f was not ideal next time and she didn't get a clear run on latest; the latter means she's yet to register anything significant after five turf outings but she might have done but for the interference.

quotes.race: Book Online @ DundalkStadium.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Circles had been running well without winning but she is probably a bit stronger now. We left it late but I didn't want to get there early and get caught - Seamie Heffernan, rider.

runners.name: Laudable
runners.comment: 2024 hat-trick at 1m2f/1m4f; unraced over this short since June 2023, a major worry
runners.spotlight: Won three (1m2f/1m4f) on the spin last August/September; disappointing in his last two races last year and again on reappearance three weeks ago, with 1m (he's unraced over this short since June 2023) a major worry today.

runners.name: Cisco Disco

prev_owners.owner: Sunday Racing Club/Grey Lady Racing Syndicate

runners.comment: Went very close over C&D last October but he now hasn't won since October 2022
runners.spotlight: Went very close over C&D last October but he now hasn't won since October 2022; reappearance three weeks ago means that he's been well beaten on three of four starts for his current yard; no headgear for last three but cheekpieces (last worn last June) are reinstated.

quotes.race: Return Of The Revival Festival Handicap
quotes.quote: Cisco Disco is a grand little horse that we decided to run him back quickly. He's a versatile horse and a turning track suits him - Jack Davison, trainer.

quotes.race: www.swordsecurity.com Nursery Handicap (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: He's improving with every run, it's just taken a while for the penny to drop. The headgear is just to help him concentrate, mentally he's a little slow to take everything in. Physically, he'll improve with time as well. He wants a bit better ground and further. Whatever happens this year is a bonus for him - Ronan Whelan, rider of Cisco Disco

runners.name: Mass Consumption
runners.comment: Unraced since March 2024; probably vulnerable back at 1m despite another career-low mark
runners.spotlight: 12-race maiden who took minor honours over as far as 2m in 2023 and 1m2f early in 2024; unraced since March 2024 and probably vulnerable in this 1m race despite another career-low mark.

runners.name: Penelopes Sister
runners.comment: 1m3f win last June; unraced over this short a trip since last May's handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Won from off the pace at Hamilton (1m3f, good) last June off 2lb lower; not disgraced on her two outings this term and making the running did not work out last time (1m4f); she's unraced over this short a trip, however, since last May's handicap debut.

runners.name: On The Bubble
runners.comment: 3rd of six at Musselburgh (1m1f) last time is clearly her most positive display this year
runners.spotlight: Won on the Flat (1m) last May and over hurdles (2m) last June; third of six at Musselburgh (1m1f) last time is clearly her most positive display this year but she needs to build on that.

4:42.race_name: Racing TV Profits Returned To Racing Handicap
4:42.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (Watering)

runners.name: Little Empire
runners.comment: Course win (1m) last year; 10lb higher but he's been threatening at Dundalk this year
runners.spotlight: Two wins in Britain last year, the second of them at this track (1m, good) when rated 10lb lower; comes here on the back of two good runs at Dundalk in the spring; one to consider.

runners.name: Leap Day
runners.comment: Poor strike-rate but he's finished second in both starts this year; in the mix once more
runners.spotlight: Just one win from 19 starts but he has run two solid races this spring, runner-up at Catterick and Leicester (both 7f on good to firm); no obvious reason why he wouldn't go well again.

runners.name: John L Sullivan
runners.comment: Talented for the grade; had a wind op since last seen in November; can rate higher in 2025
runners.spotlight: Perhaps not the most straightforward but he's talented for this grade and he won twice last year, over 1m at Wetherby and 7f at Musselburgh; more to come this year and he's had a wind operation since last seen; untried on fast ground but he's on the shortlist.

runners.name: Pallas Lord
runners.comment: Hasn't transferred his good AW form back to turf this spring
