runners.spotlight: In good form on AW this year but he's been disappointing in two runs back on turf; others have less to prove.

quotes.race: Durdar Maiden Stakes (Div I)
quotes.quote: It was a taking performance by Pallas Lord as he's been on a massive learning curve from his first two runs. The stiff track and the soft ground have suited him - Harry Russell, jockey.

runners.name: Roaring Ralph
runners.comment: On a lowly mark but he needs to bounce back from a quiet 6f run last month
runners.spotlight: Form dipped over 6f at Haydock last month; handicap mark well within range and this season's best efforts bring him into the picture; drawn widest though.

runners.name: Dwindling Funds
runners.owner: D P Van Der Hoeven & D G Pryde
runners.comment: Big step forward in new cheekpieces 3 weeks ago (6f); goes handicapping at realistic level
runners.spotlight: Unsighted on his first two starts but he showed much more when fourth of eight over 6f here three weeks ago (cheekpieces first time, retained), losing third late on; that isn't easy form to assess with confidence but he's open to more improvement now handicapping at a realistic level.

runners.name: Sir Garfield
runners.comment: C&D winner; won an apprentice race at Catterick last week; solid claims off same mark
runners.spotlight: C&D win last October; two quiet efforts to start his 4yo campaign but he was back on the up when gamely winning a 7f handicap at Catterick last week; unpenalised for that apprentice-race win so has to be of interest.

runners.name: Moyola
runners.comment: Not at best when last seen and was given a second wind op; fair mark but stamina to prove
runners.spotlight: Out of sorts when last seen around the turn of the year and he's had a wind operation since (his second); dangerous mark but has his first run over 7f this afternoon.

runners.name: Inanna
runners.comment: Beat a few of these when winning over C&D three weeks ago; solid claims up just 2lb
runners.spotlight: Won twice over sprint trips last September; off the mark for 2025 when coming from off the pace to win cosily over C&D three weeks ago; a 2lb rise doesn't handicap her out of things and she's a solid contender.

quotes.race: Culcheth Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Inanna is a very nice filly. It was a nice fair track and we decided to send her up there because she had time to organiser herself. She could drop back, she is pretty versatile, but they didn't go much of a gallop. We like her at home and we will see how she comes out of the race. We have a nice bunch of horses, we have kept the numbers down, but hopefully the two-year-olds will be nice - Sean Woods, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She was very keen when we got her- she was trying to do it all in one breath. But she's done well, winning two of her last four races, ridden by Paul Mulrennan at Carlisle and then at Hamilton by Amie Waugh. She'll probably be kept going for a while as she goes on any ground. She normally runs over 5f or 6f and might stay 7f if she relaxes. She ran over 7f at Musselburgh last month but was a bit too keen and finished second. But she's going the right way and is starting to relax and enjoy her racing. 02-10-24

runners.name: Trais Fluors

prev_owners.owner: Paul Corrigan & Miss L A Perratt

runners.comment: The old man of the party but retains ability and was third to Inanna over C&D last time
runners.spotlight: Quirky veteran who won three times on AW last year; solid third behind Inanna over C&D on his return to turf three weeks ago; today's bigger field might suit and he holds each-way claims.

quotes.race: Play Coral "Racing-Super-Series" For Free Handicap
quotes.quote: Trais Fluors was beaten by a good horse in Brentford Hope at Nottingham last time. He was suited by the better ground here, which was key. He carried a lot of weight but felt a lot better today - Silvestre de Sousa, rider.

runners.name: Carlton And Co
runners.comment: Perhaps sharper with her reappearance behind her but best form has come at sprint trips
runners.spotlight: Ended 2024 with a couple of good AW runs; may have needed the run when fifth on her reappearance at Doncaster four weeks ago; effective at 7f but her best form has come over sprint trips.

runners.name: Clasina
runners.comment: Beaten favourite in both starts this year, latterly behind Inanna over C&D three weeks ago
runners.spotlight: 11-race maiden who has been beaten favourite in both starts this year, more recently finishing fifth of six behind Inanna over C&D three weeks ago; edging down the weights but she's up in class today.

runners.name: Golden Valour
runners.comment: 1m win on this card last year; yet to shine in two starts this season
runners.spotlight: Ended a long losing run when landing the 1m apprentice handicap on this card 12 months ago; added a 7f win at Musselburgh in October but still 2lb higher and he's not found his best in two runs this year.

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Golden Valour is much better than his mark. I thought he wasn't helping Donagh up the straight but it was hard work in that wind. There's a valuable handicap here next month which we might go for - Richard O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We ran him over hurdles during the winter but he's had a break since February and will be running on the Flat again soon, where he's still only rated 55. He's a nice-looking, well-bred horse. He might do a bit of both, Flat and jumps, just to sweeten him up. He's been a bit unlucky and I‘m hopeful he can improve from his current mark when he comes out. I'm looking forward to running him. 16-05-24

runners.name: Rory
runners.comment: Capable on his day but he needs to bounce back from a low-key run at Catterick last week
runners.spotlight: Ran poorly at Catterick (7f, good to firm) last week but was drawn wide; earlier 6f third here was a fair run but others look more persuasive.

stable_tour.quote: The word that best describes this horse is frustrating. He's hugely talented but so quirky. He hates the stalls and can throw his race away at the start. He's best at Musselburgh but he needs luck in running and doesn't always get it. He's a good 10lb or even 20lb better than his mark when things go his way and he's in the right frame of mind. He was off for six weeks before his penultimate run, which blew the cobwebs away, and he won at Newcastle on Monday on his all-weather debut, when things went his way and he just got up. 12-09-22

3:00.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (Watering)

runners.name: South Shore
runners.comment: Not easily recommended but he's down in class and up in trip; latest run not too bad
runners.spotlight: Won a Windsor handicap (6f, good) 13 months ago off a 15lb higher mark; unplaced in all seven runs for Ruth Carr but he's hinted at better on a couple of occasions this year, including at Beverley last time when he didn't get a clear run at it in the home straight; down in class and up in trip; not discounted.

stable_tour.quote: A sprinter who's coming along steadily and I'm taking my time with him because he has ability. He finished down the field at Pontefract on Tuesday but should do better in time. 09-04-25

runners.name: Travis
runners.comment: On a lowly mark and looks to be building up to something better; check the market moves
runners.spotlight: Sole success came at Pontefract (6f, good) last June when trained by George Boughey; yet to be placed since switching to current yard but has suggested something bigger was brewing; market instructive.

runners.name: King Of The Jungle
runners.comment: Not beaten far at Leicester last month; reliable at his level and holds each-way claims
runners.spotlight: Two sprint wins on turf (heavy/good to soft); carried some good AW efforts back to turf at Leicester (6f, good) last month; shouldn't be far away provided the ground is suitable.

runners.name: Heritor
runners.comment: First real form over C&D on his reappearance; this handicap debut should be more suitable
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in two AW runs over further last autumn; showed more over C&D on his seasonal return but he was never in the hunt and the form wouldn't look totally convincing; betting useful now handicapping at a modest level.

runners.name: Colour Code
runners.comment: Poor form for this yard and drops back in trip with too much to prove; often slowly away
runners.spotlight: Poor form since joining this yard and slow starts are an issue; drops to 6f with too much to prove.

runners.name: Sixcor
runners.breeder: D D & Mrs J P Clee
runners.comment: C&D winner; two solid efforts so far this year; each-way claims with P Mulrennan booked
runners.spotlight: C&D winner; runner-up at Newcastle on his seasonal return in February and ran to a similar level when fourth here (5f) three weeks ago; edging down the weights and looks the pick of his trainer's three runners.

runners.name: Woohoo
runners.comment: No penalty for easy win at Hamilton last Friday (5f); hard to beat if he sees out 6f here
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish filly who had shaped well at Catterick last week before breaking her maiden with a stylish Hamilton win last Friday (5f, good to firm; for today's rider); escapes a penalty and looks well ahead of the handicapper; has to prove herself over 6f but she's of obvious interest.

runners.name: Henery Hawk

prev_owners.owner: Paul Corrigan & Miss L A Perratt
Paul Corrigan & Miss L A Perratt
Mrs D Dalby & Harrowgate Bloodstock Ltd

runners.comment: 0-19 on turf and this year's good efforts have come on AW; stable run three here
runners.spotlight: 0-19 on turf and this year's good efforts have come on AW, twice placed at Newcastle in March and not beaten far at Wolverhampton last month; one of three runners for the yard; wait for that elusive first win on grass set to continue.

runners.name: Thunderstorm Katie
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs P & J Hopper, Mrs M Morris
runners.comment: Unplaced all ten starts but has hinted at ability, including last week; others look safer
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in all ten starts but there has been the odd promising effort along the way, including at Hamilton last week; others still more appealing for win purposes.

8:00.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 6.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Versatile
runners.comment: Cashed in on reduced mark at Bath (1m2f) last week and he's respected under a penalty
runners.spotlight: Took advantage of a reduced mark when making all in four-runner handicap at Bath (1m2f, firm; second run after wind surgery) last Wednesday; this is tougher under a penalty but he battled well last time and his confidence should be boosted after that breakthrough win; respected back up in trip.

runners.name: Market House
runners.comment: Record of 31122 in AW handicaps for new yard and he looks interesting back on the Flat
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish 5yo; solid record (31122) in AW handicaps for new stable and he finished a respectable third back over hurdles at Fakenham (2m4f, good) two weeks ago; still looks on a workable mark in this sphere and both his wins have come at around 1m4f; interesting contender back on the Flat.

runners.name: Eton Blue
runners.comment: C&D winner who is on a dangerous mark but his last win was in September 2023
runners.spotlight: His last success was off 7lb higher over C&D (good) but that was in September 2023; some respectable efforts on AW during the winter and wasn't disgraced back over hurdles in March but others are more persuasive.

quotes.race: Follow At The Races On Twitter Handicap
quotes.quote: We've thought a lot of Eton Blue for a long time and thought there was more to come but he was very immature. He looked fantastic in the paddock and hopefully the handicapper won't be too hard on him and we can have a lot of fun with him. Most of our horses come on as we don't overdo them at home - George Baker, trainer.

runners.name: Pride Of Nepal
runners.comment: Only 1lb higher than for his C&D win in September and could revive on this return to turf
runners.spotlight: Struggled on AW in his two runs this season but he's 0-13 in that sphere and is now only 1lb higher than when completing a double over C&D in September; looks interesting back on turf and he needs watching in market.

quotes.race: Ring20 Better Lives With Epilepsy Amateur Jockeys' Handicap
quotes.quote: Pride Of Nepal just seems to be in great form. He's been running thereabouts and was able to win last week. He takes his racing ever so well, and by the end of last week he was bouncing again. He's so straightforward, a jockey's dream. He's a pleasure to do everything with. There's a lot of amateur races out there and the next port of call will be the Cambridgeshire. The stiff mile [and] one [furlong] would probably suit him, and he won over that trip at Goodwood. That win should put us up a few pounds so he should get in - Sarah Bowen, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Standbackandlook
runners.comment: Completed a 1m6f double at Wolverhampton last summer but he's lost his way since then
runners.spotlight: Completed a 1m6f double at Wolverhampton last summer but he's lost his way since and has been tailed off in two AW runs this spring; has lots to prove back on turf and he's 0-10 in this sphere.

runners.name: Sea Of Charm

prev_owners.owner: The Turf Club & Mrs Harry Dunlop

runners.comment: Beat an improver over C&D two weeks ago and a 3lb rise looks fair; big player
runners.spotlight: Has overall record of 4-50 but her last win was over C&D (good to firm) two weeks ago and she held off an unexposed improver in that race; 3lb rise for that success looks fair and she's a big player again with Tom Marquand booked.

runners.name: Galileos Compass
runners.comment: Nine-race maiden for three different yards and he's struggled in last four runs
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish 5yo; nine-race maiden for three different yards and he's struggled in his last four runs; mark is tumbling but he was tailed off over C&D on recent comeback and can only be watched; equipment reapplied.

stable_tour.quote: A full-brother to Changingoftheguard. His work is very nice and he makes his debut in a 1m5f maiden at Navan on Saturday. 21-04-23

6:30.race_name: Star Sports We Believe In Bookmaking Restricted Novice Stakes (For Horses In Bands C/D) (GBB Race)
6:30.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 6.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Duca Di Lucca
runners.comment: Won at Southwell (11-1) on debut but was well held there on his reappearance last month
runners.spotlight: 11-1 when making a successful debut at Southwell (7f) in October but he found things tough under a penalty there (1m; eighth of ten) on his reappearance last month; has a good pedigree and it's still early days but he needs improvement on this switch to turf.

runners.name: Immediate Effect
runners.comment: Win and close second in two AW runs in the autumn; big player upped in trip on return
runners.spotlight: Overcame a slow start and wide trip when justifying support on Wolverhampton debut (7f) in October; held in second under penalty at Southwell the following month but he finished well to go close after some traffic issues; that was good step forward on his initial form and he's an interesting contender upped to 1m on his return.

runners.name: Alfie D
runners.comment: Well held on Windsor debut last month and he needs to leave that form behind
runners.spotlight: Big market drifter out to 20-1 and he finished a remote sixth of ten on Windsor debut (1m, good to firm) last month; should know more this time but he needs to leave that initial form well behind.

runners.name: Grey Phoenix
runners.comment: Her best form puts her firmly in the picture and she's respected back up in trip
runners.spotlight: Finished fourth in all three runs, with her best effort at Wolverhampton (7f, AW) on her second start; that form puts her firmly in the picture and she may have needed the run behind a useful prospect at Lingfield (hood added) last month; made some late gains in that race and she's respected back up in trip on turf debut.

runners.name: Salve Electra
runners.comment: Well held in two AW runs and needs plenty of progress now upped to 1m on turf debut
runners.spotlight: Well held at biggish prices in two AW runs (7f), most recently when fifth of eight on Lingfield reappearance last month; this step up in trip looks a good move on pedigree but she needs plenty of progress to make a serious impact.

7:30.race_name: Download The Star Sports App Handicap
7:30.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 6.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Poetic Force

prev_owners.owner: S Barton & Exors of the Late W McLuskey

runners.comment: Showed the fire still burns when third of eight here last month.
runners.spotlight: Veteran who has been a wonderful servant to connections with 15 wins; last win was in August 2023 but showed the fire still burns when third of eight here (7f, good to firm) last month; down to a career-low mark and holds place claims at least.

quotes.race: MansionBet Beaten By A Head Claiming Stakes
quotes.quote: Tony (Carroll) thought Poetic Force would need the run after such a long layoff so fair play to him. They didn't go any pace which helped. David Probert - Jockey

quotes.race: 32Red Casino Handicap
quotes.quote: We have not had Poetic Force that long and I am still learning about him in some ways. He has done that well and is the type we will keep going on the grass when the spring comes - Tony Carroll, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Middle Distance Handicap
quotes.quote: I've ridden Poetic Force at home and he has a nice turn of foot. They didn't go mad and I thought it played into our hands - George Downing, jockey.

quotes.race: 32Red.com Claiming Stakes
quotes.quote: Poetic Force went up 9lb for winning which we thought was a bit harsh so we dropped him to a claimer. This is his trip and he'll get further - Jonathan Portman, trainer.

quotes.race: 32RedSport.com Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Poetic Force had a good draw and was very straightforward.  The race worked out nicely just having a tow off the leaders.  Adam's horse picked up but my lad always had it covered - Richard Kingscote, jockey.

runners.name: Comedian Leader

prev_owners.owner: Aj Racing G Kelleway N Sowerby D Beedle

runners.comment: Successful over C&D last month off 5lb lower mark and second since back here.
runners.spotlight: Got her just rewards following a series of consistent efforts when successful over C&D (good to firm) last month off 5lb lower mark; runner-up over C&D subsequently and should be thereabouts once more.

runners.name: Devasboy
runners.comment: Respectable third at Wolverhampton in March and at Chepstow eight days ago.
runners.spotlight: Without a win since 2022 but respectable third at Wolverhampton (7f, AW) in March and at Chepstow (7f, good) eight days ago; should not be far away.

runners.name: Shot Of Love
runners.comment: On a losing run going back to February 2024; on a career-low mark but hard to recommend.
runners.spotlight: On a losing run going back to February 2024 and switches to turf for the first time since August last year; on a career-low mark but hard to recommend.

stable_tour.quote: He had a couple of runs at the Curragh for Ger Lyons and didn't show much. He joined us at the back end and, although I have yet to get his head in front, he's showing some ability. Unfortunately he had been a bit coltish, so we've gelded him and he seems much better. I think that should bring out plenty of improvement from him. It's hard to know what his trip is, but he doesn't jump out as a sprinter and is more likely to run over a mile next. 22-03-23

runners.name: River Wharfe
runners.comment: All three turf wins have been here over 7f; course form brings him into play.
runners.spotlight: All three turf wins have been here over 7f; has been running with credit on AW over the winter and back on turf for the first time since last October; usual headgear left off on this occasion and his course form brings him into play.

stable_tour.quote: He holds entries at Brighton in two classified events - the 0-50 mile event on Wednesday and the 0-50 7f contest on Thursday. He's run at Brighton three times this season with one win, a third and a fourth, so hopefully he can go well again. 07-08-24

runners.name: Werenotreallyhere
runners.comment: Fair third over C&D last month but below that form back over C&D since.
runners.spotlight: Losing run is totting up and although he was a fair third over C&D last month he ran below that form back over C&D since when three places behind Comedian Leader; easy to look elsewhere.

runners.name: Roundabout Silver
runners.comment: Without a win since August 2023 but in the frame on his last three starts on AW.
runners.spotlight: Without a win since August 2023 but in the frame on his last three starts on AW; holds place claims on return to turf.

runners.name: Edergoles Gift
runners.comment: Poor form from 5f-1m2f this year; others preferred.
runners.spotlight: Sole success was in a 7f AW classified last summer; poor form from 5f-1m2f this year; first-time hood goes on but others preferred.

8:30.race_name: Tips For Every Race At raceday-ready.com Handicap (Brighton Summer Sprint Series Qualifier)
8:30.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 6.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Tronido
runners.comment: Back on turf for the first time since last September but others preferred.
runners.spotlight: Won her first two handicaps on AW last June but handicapper has been in charge since; back on turf for the first time since last September but others preferred.

runners.name: Purefoy
runners.comment: Inauspicious seasonal/stable debut when last of five over C&D 13 days ago.
runners.spotlight: Sole success came on handicap debut on Lingfield AW in April last year when trained by Andrew Balding; form tailed off subsequently and sold for 8,000gns in October; inauspicious seasonal/stable debut when last of five over C&D 13 days ago; first-time tongue-tie now applied alongside usual cheekpieces; hard to fancy.

runners.name: Local Bay
runners.comment: Showed he was on the way back when runner-up here three weeks ago.
runners.spotlight: Had a good time of it last year with four wins, the latest over C&D in August off 8lb higher mark; form fizzled out but showed he was on the way back when runner-up here (1m, good to firm) three weeks ago; undeniably well handicapped and one to be interested in.

quotes.race: Spreadex Sports £300 Spread Betting Cashback Handicap
quotes.quote: After Local Bay's win last week the only thing we had in the back of our minds was the bounce factor, backing him up too quickly. He's one of those horses that needs that early gallop to drop his head and get into a rhythm - Jack Mitchell, rider, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Mashaan
runners.comment: Respectable second of five back on turf over C&D 13 days ago and place claims once again.
runners.spotlight: All four of his wins from 49 starts have been on AW, with the most recent coming at Lingfield over 7f in March off 8lb lower; respectable second of five back on turf over C&D (good to firm) 13 days ago and place claims once again.

stable_tour.quote: We got him from Richard Fahey as an 18-race maiden, but the change of scenery certainly did him some good as he won at the second time of asking and followed that up three weeks later at Chelmsford. Those were both on the all-weather, but he will be just as effective on the turf, especially with a bit of cut in the ground. He pings the gate like a greyhound, but last time out at Doncaster, back on turf, they had not watered, and it was good to firm which was no good to him. To bring out the best in him he needs some ease on a turning track. As for trip, I think he's at his best over 7f on a turning track like Chester, or alternatively a stiff 6f on a straight course. 04-05-22

runners.name: Under Curfew
runners.comment: Scored at Wolverhampton in February but all nine wins have been between 5f-6f.
runners.spotlight: Durable veteran who showed the flame still burns when winning at Wolverhampton (6f, AW) in February but all nine wins have been between 5f-6f; may be best to wait until he drops in trip.

quotes.race: Best Free Tips At valuerater.co.uk Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Under Curfew travelled beautifully. I was told to follow our other horse [Bezzas Lad] but he went off too quick. We slotted in and he couldn't try any more for me ? I couldn't stop screaming from two out - Mollie Phillips, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He won at Bath in May and then again at Salisbury last month.  He was second at Bath last Friday night - it looked an easy opportunity for him with just three runners, but they're never easy and 5f on very fast ground probably just caught him out - he's more a 6f horse really. The winner of the race is possibly all right. He'll run in the Bullet at Brighton on Friday. All ground comes alike to him and he's in good form. 07-08-24

runners.name: Havana Mojito
runners.comment: Goes well here and landed his second course win last month off 8lb lower mark.
runners.spotlight: Goes well here and landed his second course win (1m, good to firm) last month off 8lb lower mark; clearly progressive and holds strong claims.

runners.name: Thanks Dad
runners.comment: Didn't appear to handle the camber when fourth over C&D three weeks ago.
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark at Southwell (7f, AW) in March; rated lower on turf and didn't appear to handle the camber when fourth over C&D (good to firm) three weeks ago; opposable.

runners.name: Starsong

prev_owners.owner: Mrs J E Mulhern & David S McGuinness

runners.comment: Second of seven over 7.5f at Beverley 16 days ago; holds claims.
runners.spotlight: All five wins have been on AW over 6f but has returned to turf for the first time in two years and has been placed at Leicester and Beverley recently, latest when second of seven over 7.5f 16 days ago; holds claims.

runners.name: Voltaic
runners.comment: Ran well when third to Havana Mojito here before a good second over C&D three weeks ago.
runners.spotlight: Is finding it hard to get his head in front but ran well when third to Havana Mojito (with whom he's 8lb better off) here before a good second over C&D three weeks ago; holds place claims.

quotes.race: alex@alexdonohuepr.co.uk Classified Claiming Stakes
quotes.quote: Voltaic has relished the ground and relaxed over that trip - Sean Levey, rider.

runners.name: Invincible Navy
runners.comment: 0-15 and no signs that things are about to change.
runners.spotlight: 0-15 and no signs that things are about to change.

6:00.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 6.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Sioux Warrior
runners.comment: 0-10 but was an eyecatching second at Nottingham latest; big player if he can back that up
runners.spotlight: Ten-race maiden but he's well treated on his best form and was an eyecatching second when dropped back to 5f at Nottingham (good; 4-1) two weeks ago; this is his first run at Brighton but he's a big player if he can take another step back in the direction.

runners.name: Harry Brown
runners.owner: Peter Crate And Gallagher Bloodstock Ltd
runners.comment: All four wins have been on AW and he's 0-14 on turf; others are more persuasive
runners.spotlight: Four-time AW winner and his last success was off 1lb lower at Lingfield (6f) last month; not beaten far at Windsor (5f) and Brighton (6f, both on good to firm) since but he's now 0-14 on turf and this is competitive back in trip; others preferred.

quotes.race: It's Time To Turn To talkSPORT Handicap
quotes.quote: Harry Brown is a 5f horse really but gets 6f around here. He did that well as he had a lot of weight and will be an interesting horse on the grass - Hayley Turner, jockey.

runners.name: Pop Dancer

prev_owners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd

runners.comment: Dual C&D winner who made all at Goodwood latest; respected off 3lb higher
runners.spotlight: Recorded his tenth win when making all to beat four rivals at Goodwood (5f, good) 18 days ago; up 3lb but that was a comfortable success and he's won twice over C&D on the past; should make another bold bid back at this track.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: We thought Pop Dancer would win first time and it was just greenness that beat him. He did it well today - assistant trainer Robin O'Ryan.

runners.name: Coolagh Magic
runners.owner: Lady Emma Oshea And A Carson
runners.comment: 0-16 on turf but was second at Yarmouth latest and has claims if he can repeat that form
runners.spotlight: All nine wins have been on AW; 0-16 on turf but he's on a lower mark in this sphere and he caught the eye with a strong-finishing second at Yarmouth (5f, good to firm) last month; on unchanged mark and has possibilities if he can back that up.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Home Of The Odds Boost Handicap
quotes.quote: Coolagh Magic jumped out well and when I asked for a change of gear, he'd gone. He's always worked quite well and is probably getting quicker, having won over five here - Tony Hamilton, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He only came to us this summer and I deliberately didn't rush him. I thought he would go well first time out at Lingfield earlier this month but it was a pleasant surprise to see him come home in front. In his younger days he had won off a loftier mark, but he has been working well and I expect him to go on from here. 15-09-21

runners.name: Its Showtime
runners.comment: Well held in last two starts and record now stands at 1-23; others are more convincing
runners.spotlight: On a dangerous mark but she's not fired in her last two runs and was almost 4l behind Coolagh Magic at Yarmouth (9-4 favourite) last month; that took her overall record to 1-23 and others are more convincing; tongue-tie removed.

runners.name: Mary Of Modena
runners.comment: On reduced mark but she needs major revival on her return after wind surgery
runners.spotlight: Now 11lb lower than for her last success but that was in August 2023 and she generally struggled last season; returns having had wind surgery but she has plenty to prove after 202 days off; unraced on faster on good and last two wins were on soft.

quotes.race: Read Kevin Blake On attheraces.com Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: I thought I'd got beat to be honest as this six furlongs is a as far as Mary Of Modena wants to go on this ground. Ideally she wants five furlongs on soft - William Carson, jockey

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Handicap
quotes.quote: Mary Of Modena likes a bit of cut in the ground. She was temperamental and still is, but she's capable and probably five furlongs is her limit. She hopefully won't go up much for this so perhaps we can find a similar 0-60 for her and, with a bit of juice in the ground, there's no reason she can't win again - Michael Attwater, trainer.

runners.name: Anglesey Lad
runners.comment: In fair form here in last three runs but needs to find more to get off the mark
runners.spotlight: Can take a strong hold and is 0-17 but he's been in fair form here in last three runs including a 2l fourth over C&D (good to firm) two weeks ago; should be in the mix again but he needs to find more to get off the mark.

stable_tour.quote: He ran really well last week at Brighton when he was unlucky not to win. The first-time blinkers helped him in the first part of the race more than anything as he wasn't getting into gear in enough time. He's well handicapped off his mark of 54 as he's a 65-rated horse on his day. He's been second on three of his last four starts and is unlucky not to have won by now, but he'll have his day. Five furlongs is too short for him and going up to 6f on a galloping track will suit him better. He may head to Carlisle on Friday and he'll be winning pretty soon. 30-05-24

7:00.race_name: Star Sports Brighton Owners Series Handicap
7:00.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 6.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Warm Glow
runners.comment: Disappointing on turf/handicap debut when eighth of 12 at Nottingham last month.
runners.spotlight: Has shown glimpses of ability in three AW novice fillies' contests but proved to be disappointing on turf/handicap debut when eighth of 12 at Nottingham (8.5f, good to firm) last month; drops back in trip and class and not one to give up on yet.

runners.name: Callout
runners.comment: Well held on stable debut when fifth of seven at Windsor 16 days ago.
runners.spotlight: Best form when third of eight on AW debut at Southwell (1m) in February when trained by Ed Bethell in first-time blinkers; sold for 4,400gns in March and well held on stable debut in first-time visor (retained) when fifth of seven at Windsor (1m, good to firm) 16 days ago; best watched.

runners.name: Mr Ubiquitous
runners.comment: Just lasted home to win by a nose at Windsor 23 days ago; should progress.
runners.spotlight: Back on turf following a three-month break, he just lasted home to win by a nose at Windsor (1m, good to firm) 23 days ago; should progress and the drop back in trip should not be an issue; holds every chance of following up.

runners.name: Prima Diva
runners.comment: Yet to make the frame from four starts on AW, latest when ninth of 11 at Wolverhampton.
runners.spotlight: Yet to make the frame from four starts on AW, latest when ninth of 11 on handicap debut at Wolverhampton (7f); first-time cheekpieces now applied on turf debut but hard to fancy.

runners.name: Muy Muy Loco
runners.comment: Ran his best race to date when beaten a neck at Kempton 16 days ago.
runners.spotlight: Ran his best race to date when beaten a neck at Kempton (7f, AW) 16 days ago despite hanging left-handed in the home straight; should run well if he can translate that form back on turf.

runners.name: Miakoda
runners.comment: Didn't get the gaps when sixth of ten at Ripon 12 days ago; not out of this.
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark at Newcastle (7f, AW) when making all in March off 3lb lower mark; didn't get the gaps when sixth of ten at Ripon (6f, good) 12 days ago; first-time visor now applied alongside the tongue-tie and not out of this.

runners.name: Latona
runners.comment: Consistent filly who was fourth of 12 at Yarmouth last month.
runners.spotlight: Consistent filly who was well placed until faltering close home when fourth of 12 at Yarmouth (1m, good) last month; drops to a career-low mark and holds place claims.

runners.name: Rock Master
runners.comment: Led but easily swept aside when third of eight at Chelmsford 20 days ago.
runners.spotlight: The odd promising effort but he's not progressing; led but easily swept aside when third of eight at Chelmsford (7f, AW) 20 days ago; headgear removed on this return to turf and needs to show improvement.

runners.name: Mount Of Gold
runners.comment: Showed little on seasonal debut when sixth of seven at Bath 16 days ago.
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden who showed little on seasonal debut when sixth of seven at Bath (1m, firm) 16 days ago; first-time blinkers go on but has it all to do.

runners.name: Annexation

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late S F Hui

runners.comment: Consistent on the Flat this year but only third in claimer when back over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Consistent on the Flat for Tony Carroll this year but managed only third in Fakenham claimer (2m, good) when back over hurdles a fortnight ago; needs a much better performance to overcome top weight in this handicap.

quotes.race: Crowne Plaza Hotel Dundalk Race & Stay Handicap
quotes.quote: Annexation missed the beat a bit and it was ideal as I had something to aim at the whole way. I think this is his ideal trip and he could win another one up here - Chris Hayes, rider

stable_tour.quote: He was really good at Navan in his maiden hurdle and we were aiming for the novice hurdle at Tipperary but he wasn't right. He seems in good form again and we might aim him at the For Auction Novice Hurdle at Navan. He handled soft ground on the Flat, although whether he'll be as effective on it over hurdles we'll see. We'll feel our way with him in the autumn and if he handles soft ground we can plot our way through the winter with him. 09-11-20

runners.name: Sayva
runners.comment: Dual novice winner last season; flopped on latest outing but may still have potential
runners.spotlight: Won twice in novice company towards end of last year (2m1f/2m3f) and came second on handicap debut at Carlisle (2m3f, good to soft) in March; disappointed when upped to 2m5f for latest run but may still have potential.

quotes.race: Dunes Bowling Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We found a good opportunity for Sayva today. I really liked him when he won his bumper. I was very happy with him going to Sedgefield but, with it being his first run over hurdles, I wasn't going to be able to ride him how I did today. But, with the benefit of a run, he was very straightforward today - Richie McLernon, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He needed the run on his debut over hurdles at Sedgefield and stripped fitter for that when winning comfortably at Newcastle last week. He likes good ground and we'll probably look for another race under a penalty. He might go for one of those races on Trials day at Musselburgh in February in the long term and should be capable of winning plenty of races. 06-11-24

runners.name: Enthused
runners.comment: Out of form on the Flat this year and reverts to hurdling with quite a bit to prove
runners.spotlight: Prolific hurdle winner on good ground over last couple of years but out of form when last seen over jumps in the autumn and this year's Flat form has also been disappointing; ran particularly poorly on latest outing (usual cheekpieces absent) and comes here with quite a bit to prove.

quotes.race: Friends & Family Remembering Norman Sharpe Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I thought the ground would be on the soft side for Enthused as he likes it rattling but fair play to him and he only ran on the Flat a week ago. Alex Chadwick, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Welcome Back To Ludlow Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It's amazing, you can't top it. I had Enthused in my hands the whole way and his jumping is perfect. He doesn't get much height but he's very quick and he took me to the front and off we went - Jamie Gambin, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Visit racingtv.com Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Enthused ran well at Fakenham but got trapped on the inside when they had taken the last hurdle out and he was unlucky. He was given a great ride from Alex Chadwick and will run next at Fakenham's final meeting of the year next month - James Owen, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's owned by good friends of mine, the butcher Michael Clarke and the farmer George Wright, and he's a lovely little horse who cost me£5,500 this time last year. He's run 17 times since then, won five times and earned just under£45,000. He's ultra-consistent but very ground-dependent; he needs top of the ground. We probably shouldn't have run him at Cheltenham last time when the rain came. He had a history of breaking blood vessels but I hope we've sorted that out we turn the horses out a lot and he's gained confidence. He's having a break and will be back in the spring. Two miles is his trip. 06-12-23

runners.name: In This World
runners.comment: In good form over fences for Dan Skelton in early part of last season; stable debut today
runners.spotlight: In good form over fences for Dan Skelton in early part of last season and reverts to hurdling on a good mark but this debut for Rob Summers comes after a ten-month absence.

quotes.race: PJ Nicholls KGM Korea Genuinely Made Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: In This World looked like being a really good horse over hurdles, but got a major injury. That's well in the past now and he's winning races, and will hopefully continue to do so through the summer - Dan Skelton, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He leaped to the front of the Triumph Hurdle market when he won at Warwick last season, showing a lot of speed. Unfortunately, he cut himself and hit a vein, which then retracted, and we couldn't stop it bleeding. He had to go to the vet to have it sealed off and there was a tiny bit of infection, which put us back and ultimately ended his season. He's only four but is obviously very good. He's still an entire from a fabulous family, so our intention is to make him into a stallion if he's good enough. If he was to win a handicap, I might get adventurous and throw him in at the deep end but you won't see him before Christmas. 15-11-22

runners.name: Ukantango
runners.comment: Not the force of old but ran quite well last month and is on a very tempting mark now
runners.spotlight: No longer the force of old but did not have race run to suit his patient tactics when third at Chepstow (2m, good) last month, after a layoff, and has dropped 3lb to another career-low mark here; must be considered.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Supreme Trial Novices' Hurdle (Registered As The Sharp Novices' Hurdle) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ukantango ran very well, that was a step up in grade and he ran a funny race really ? I thought he was going nowhere at the top of the hill and he was in front at the bottom of it! I don't know what we'll do next as he's had a very hard race but we're very happy - Olly Murphy, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had an issue at the end of last season and will be seen a little bit later than first anticipated. He's well handicapped over fences but wants nice ground. 24-10-24

He's hopefully going to improve for a fence and will make his start in the next few weeks on what I think is a nice mark. He jumps really well and he is one I've always been looking forward to going chasing with, so this is an exciting season for him. 01-11-23

runners.name: Time Interval

prev_owners.owner: P Inglett, S De Zoete And C Milln

runners.comment: Dominated from the front at Stratford two weeks ago and is now 2-7 over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Made all under very positive ride at Stratford (2m2f, good) two weeks ago and is now 2-7 over hurdles; may find it harder to dominate this higher-grade contest but is evidently in very good nick.

runners.name: Commanding View
runners.comment: Back on a workable mark now but needs to rebound from below-par run four weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Reverted to hurdling with pretty good effort at Exeter (2m, good) last month and is back down to a workable mark now but needs to rebound from a below-par run at Bangor four weeks ago.

stable_tour.quote: He's a proper terrier and a bumptious character. He's not very big but his stable name at home is ‘Naughty' because affectionately he's like that by nature. However, he just keeps battling and trying in his races. He was fifth at Taunton over 2m last week and our doubt was that the ground was slightly on the softer side and that he had 12st, which wasn't ideal for a small horse. He's a nice horse for novice handicap chases and there's lots to like about him. 16-01-25

runners.name: Tara Iti
runners.comment: Dual hurdle winner for new stable this spring; may yet have a bigger run in him
runners.spotlight: Revitalised by new stable this spring, winning two low-grade hurdles on good ground; took fairly heavy fall at Huntingdon last month and was slightly disappointing on the Flat 12 days ago but may yet have a bigger run in him.

quotes.race: Veolia Nursery Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Tara Iti is bred to go on this testing ground. He travelled well despite being a little keen early. I took it up early enough, but he kept it up all the way to the line - Andrea Atzeni, jockey.

runners.name: Gwennie May Star
runners.breeder: Sc Racing Investment Society Ecurie Ris
runners.comment: 2-8 over hurdles last season; contender if he takes well to fences at first attempt
runners.spotlight: 2-8 over hurdles last season, the latter win gained in first-time cheekpieces at Bangor (2m3f, good) last month; disappointed when upped to 3m1f a few days later but drops back in trip here and it will be interesting to see how he fares on this chasing debut.

runners.name: A Dublin Job
runners.comment: Took very well to chasing last season, winning twice; returns from 11-month layoff here
runners.spotlight: 0-15 over hurdles but took very well to fences in early part of last season, making all on good ground at Huntingdon (2m4f) and Market Rasen (2m3f); has fitness to prove after 11-month absence but further progress is possible this year.

runners.name: Cat Tiger
runners.breeder: J Haimet & Har De La Croix Sonnet
runners.comment: Regressive 11yo; well held when third last month; needs to up his game
runners.spotlight: Very useful hunter/handicap chaser in his prime but has regressed over the last year or so; ran well for a long way at Stratford (2m1f, good to soft) in March but ought to have been suited by the soft ground when well-held third at Ffos Las (2m3f) last month; needs to up his game.

quotes.race: SBK Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I thought I had taken it up two out at Doncaster and I looked up and saw there were three fences left, and I was thinking 'whadda mistake-a to make-a'. I thought I hit the front too soon here again but in the end horses like Cat Tiger are easy to ride. He jumped brilliantly and never missed a fence. I was able to hold him until I wanted and then he had a turn of foot too. The second kept coming back to him and the line just wasn't coming fast enough, so I was delighted to get there. It is worth thinking back to last year when amateurs weren't allowed to ride. It was dark times but these days make up for it - David Maxwell, jockey.

quotes.race: Visit attheraces.com/jumps EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Cat Tiger is an absolute diamond to ride and probably wants a bit more of a test so I was always going to do the donkey work on him. Like a lot of the French horses he is a good jumper and very straightforward. Our win at Auteuil ruled him out of hunter chases this season which I bought him for - David Maxwell, owner-rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's given David Maxwell some great thrills and is likely to follow a similar route to last season, mixing some handicap chases with hunter chasing in the spring. His first big target last season was the Grand Sefton at Aintree, after he'd jumped so well round there to be third in the Foxhunters' earlier that year. This time he made a few mistakes on ground that was softer than ideal. Switching back to handicaps, he should have won at Doncaster in December but made amends when David gave him a great ride to win at Ascot. They went on to have another crack at the Foxhunters', going one better when a close second. So, having jumped round Aintree on all three attempts, a third crack at the Foxhunters' will again be his ultimate target. 31-10-22

runners.name: Davidoc
runners.comment: Seemingly back in peak form when second of ten over C&D last month; major player
runners.spotlight: 0-5 over fences but looked back in peak form when close second of ten over C&D (good) last month and is arguably fortunate to have been nudged up only 1lb for that run; major player.

stable_tour.quote: I have plenty of time for this one, who's come here after winning the last of his four point-to-points in Ireland by 19 lengths. He's a hard horse who jumps for fun and he could be well above average. 10-11-23

runners.name: Tribesmans Glory
runners.comment: Won this in 2024 and ran big race at Chepstow two starts ago; respected
runners.spotlight: Pulled up on heavy ground on two of last three appearances but between those he ran a big race when third on good ground at Chepstow (2m3f); back on a sound surface today and only 2lb higher than when landing this prize in 2024; respected.

runners.name: King Of The Road
runners.comment: Not seen since struggling on heavy ground in January but ended 2024 in good form
runners.spotlight: Absent since struggling on heavy ground in January but ended 2024 in good form, notably when winning by a neck at Taunton (2m3f, good to soft); can make his presence felt if fully tuned up after 113-day break.

runners.name: Getalead
runners.comment: Gained two of his eight hurdle wins over C&D; ran okay last week; still on workable mark
runners.spotlight: Gained two of his eight hurdle wins over this C&D on good ground; raced a bit lazily in first-time blinkers at Newton Abbot (2m2f, good) a week ago but eventually kept on well for a close third; remains on a workable mark and is sure to be suited by the return to this track.

runners.name: Playtogetaway
runners.comment: Returned to form with November win; pulled up when reappearing in February
runners.spotlight: Bounced back to form with hard-fought win at Southwell (2m4f, good) in November but was pulled up when reappearing over 3m1f in February and has been off for another three months since; not an easy one to predict.

runners.name: Honneur Dajonc
runners.comment: Recent Fakenham second came in plating company; others in this line-up appeal more
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner since switching to current stable last summer but the latter success was gained in a seller and his recent second in first-time blinkers at Fakenham (2m, good) was also in plating company; will be fine over today's longer trip but others appeal more.

quotes.race: AK Bets Watch All UK Racing Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Honneur d'Ajonc is quite quirky and it's taken a while to get him where he is today. He doesn't like being crowded and didn't enjoy being boxed in on the rails at Perth last time. Today he's had the dream run round - Alex Chadwick, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Tribute Cornwall Pale Ale Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We thought we'd lost Honneur D'Ajonc at Kempton last season and it took a long time for him to recover from that, so it's very rewarding to see him going the right way now. He's a proper horse and exactly what we thought he was going to be. This would have been the limit of his stamina but he's versatile and has grown over the last year - Jane Williams, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We bought him at Doncaster in the spring. He's won for us and ran very well the other day on heavy ground at Haydock over 2m3f, which is good as it opens up more avenues. I think he'll stay further. New owners at my yard have got involved with him and they've purchased another horse recently, so they're having a good bit of fun. 01-01-25

runners.name: Clondaw Royale
runners.comment: Soft-ground winner during winter; ended last season with disappointing run on good ground
runners.spotlight: Scored on soft ground at Haydock (3m) in December and made the frame on his next two outings (2m5f/3m1f) but ended last season with a disappointing run on good ground and the lively conditions are a worry again here.

quotes.race: Thank You John Burgess Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Clondaw Royale is a really nice horse and I'm delighted to get that win with him. The further he went, the better he got. Hopefully, he'll be a nice stayer in the future - James Smith, jockey.

runners.name: Mr Yeats
runners.breeder: Mrs D Dewbery & Mrs B Woodcock
runners.comment: Seemingly in process of running well before falling on stable debut; still on good mark
runners.spotlight: Five-time hurdle winner (2m4f-3m2f) who is very well suited by good ground; seemingly in process of running well before penultimate-flight fall on stable debut at Carlisle (2m3f, good) six weeks ago and remains on a good mark; major player if all goes to plan here.

quotes.race: Lorna Brooke Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: That was my first ride for Milton. My agent Gordy [Clarkson] got me on Mr Yeats so credit to him. It was straightforward, he's very small and Milton said to me that I wouldn't have ridden anything smaller than him but he was gutsy and jumped really well - Gina Andrews, rider.

quotes.race: Try Racing TV For Free Now Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: This trip was sharp enough around here today for Mr Yeats but he toughed it out. He's still quite a young horse so hopefully there's more to come - Mitchell Bastyan, rider.

stable_tour.quote: I train all three of Va'vite's progeny, Presenting Yeats, Hasty Parisian and this fellow, and all of them have ability. He has done well this season, winning at Wincanton and Huntingdon, and is having a break until the spring. He has progressed well and will win more races. 19-01-22

runners.name: Crystal Glance
runners.comment: Progressive mare with 3-8 strike-rate over hurdles; moves up in trip today
runners.spotlight: 3-8 over hurdles; took form to new level when clearcut winner at Uttoxeter in March and was not discredited when second of three behind short-odds favourite at Stratford (also 2m, good) a fortnight ago; moves up in trip today and may still have more to offer.

runners.name: Slievegar
runners.comment: Pulled up on first two stable starts but the faster ground here ought to suit better
runners.spotlight: Five-time point winner; pulled up in two chases for new stable at start of this year and returns from break with quite a bit to prove but drops in grade here and the faster ground ought to suit him better; not ruled out.

runners.name: Pride Of Paris
runners.owner: Dallyn, De Wilde, Haggett, Metters, Yeo
runners.comment: Battled on well to go close in new cheekpieces this month; still unexposed over fences
runners.spotlight: Safely held when favourite for first two stable starts but battled on well for close second in first-time cheekpieces at Uttoxeter (3m, good) this month and remains lightly raced over fences; good chance.

runners.name: Ballynaheer
runners.comment: 0-7 over fences but stayed on for close third over C&D last month; one to consider
runners.spotlight: 0-7 over fences but seemed to have emerged from a spell in the doldrums when staying on well for close third over C&D (good; refitted cheekpieces) last month and has obvious claims if in similar form again.

runners.name: Calagogo
runners.comment: Didn't run badly on last two appearances but others have more pressing claims all the same
runners.spotlight: Didn't run badly when sixth over C&D (good; Ballynaheer third) in first-time blinkers last month and seemed to give pretty good account when second of three behind 1-50 winner in 2m4f beginners' chase here 11 days ago but others have more pressing claims all the same.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Calagogo loved the ground and the cheekpieces really helped him - Jordan Gainford, rider.

stable_tour.quote: A good servant. He's won three for us this year and was a good fourth at Cheltenham recently. We might try to qualify him for the Pertemps, he was pulled up in a qualifier at Punchestown on Sunday, but he'll be a lovely horse to go chasing with next year. 15-11-21

runners.name: Eightytwo Team
runners.comment: Kept on well for second two weeks ago but this inconsistent mare has a poor strike-rate
runners.spotlight: Stuck to her task pretty well when close second in four-runner mares' chase at Huntingdon (2m7f, good) two weeks ago but this inconsistent 9yo has a very modest strike-rate and is not the percentage call.

runners.name: Mcgregors Charge
runners.comment: Ran big race in defeat last month, after long layoff, but well held since; hard to predict
runners.spotlight: Maiden pointer; returned from long absence with big run in defeat at Taunton (2m7f, good to firm) last month but was tailed off at Uttoxeter 18 days ago and it's hard to know what to expect from him here.

2:40.race_name: Logicor William Eborall Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: Beau Gold
runners.breeder: Sarl Igep Haras Du Chateau De Rabodanges
runners.comment: Looked in need of more time when fading right out of a bumper and maiden hurdle last term.
runners.spotlight: Some appeal on pedigree for 2m-2m5f hurdles, but looked in need of more time when fading right out of a Uttoxeter bumper (good) and Ffos Las maiden hurdle (2m, soft) last autumn/winter.

runners.name: Jefe Triunfo
runners.comment: Worcester bumper winner two years ago (2m, good); related to 2m-2m6f jumps scorers.
runners.spotlight: Exactly two years since his Worcester bumper success (2m, good) and unable to build on that form effort to any extent on either sighting since; jumps winners from 2m-2m6f in immediate family, and precise requirements over hurdles at this stage may take a race or two to become clear.

quotes.race: Every Horse Turned Out Daily richardnewlandracing.com Open NH Flat Race (Cat 1 Elimination) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Chris (Gordon) said he quite liked Jefe Triunfo beforehand. I think he's probably too nice to keep going right the way through the summer - Harry Cobden, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Pillar The Poet
runners.comment: Looked ready for this sort of trip at Hereford latest (2m); likelier one for handicaps.
runners.spotlight: Only outpaced on the final turn in at Hereford last time (2m, good; beaten 16l), serving notice that today's longer sort of trip is closer to present optimum; likelier one for handicaps after this.

runners.name: The Long Walk
runners.comment: This would be a lot easier than the Cheltenham Class 2 of last time; can take advantage.
runners.spotlight: Weakening late effort on both hurdles starts thus far, but still recorded another big personal best RPR last time in an appreciably warmer Cheltenham contest (2m4.5f, good); can make the drop in class count.

runners.name: Two To Tango
runners.breeder: J R Lavelle & Dr Mark Scott

prev_owners.owner: J R Lavelle And Paul G Jacobs

runners.comment: Still to convert any of his many podium finishes, including following wind surgery latest.
runners.spotlight: Consistent all of last term other than on genuinely soft ground, but March's Plumpton handicap third (2m5f, good) on his first outing following wind surgery was a fifth podium finish of the season without converting any; vulnerable again to anything more upwardly mobile.

stable_tour.quote: Showed plenty in his bumpers last season but just struggled to get to the line. He's done some very good bits of work and I think he could win a novice hurdle. He'll start over two miles but will get two and a half in time. 22-11-23

It's so annoying that he's been placed in seven of his ten runs and has yet to win. He wasn't right last year and this season he's been done for a bit of toe at the end of his races over 2m. He improved for stepping up to 2m3f at Taunton but bumped into a well-treated rival, who won a valuable handicap hurdle there on his next start. He remains in very good form and is a winner waiting to happen at 2m4f. 29-01-25

runners.name: Roadshow

prev_owners.owner: Derrick Smith & Michael Tabor & Mrs John Magnier
Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
Derrick Smith & Michael Tabor & Mrs John Magnier

runners.comment: Could still jump better late on, but finished closer again at Newton Abbot latest; chance.
runners.spotlight: Still needs to learn to jump better under late pressure, but this month's Newton Abbot 3l second (2m1f, good) rates his closest finish yet in this discipline; need for longer trip assumed rather than proven.

stable_tour.quote: Another of the French imports, who was bought at the Arqana Sale in July. He won his only Flat start at two for Andre Fabre, but rather lost his way this year. We've gelded him and he's recently back from a wind op, so won't be out in juvenile hurdles until after Christmas. 04-11-24

3:10.race_name: Logicor Warwickshire Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Cusano
runners.comment: Better for wind surgery when second in a Plumpton 0-110 latest; chance down in grade.
runners.spotlight: Better for a break and wind surgery when a keeping-on 10l second in a Plumpton 0-110 latest (2m, good; hampered last); doesn't get the longer trip that performance hinted may suit, but down in grade and mark unchanged.

runners.name: Birthday Angel
runners.comment: Initial mark looks plausible judged on the form of his Plumpton debut effort; respected.
runners.spotlight: Serviceable efforts in Polytrack handicaps since last seen over hurdles in December, and initial mark looks plausible judged on the form of his Plumpton debut effort (2m, good to soft); no forlorn hope.

runners.name: Iolaos Du Mou
runners.comment: Back-to-form Uttoxeter second this month (2m, good); debuted hood retained; back up 2lb.
runners.spotlight: Most affirmative statement since his Nicky Henderson days when 3l second at Uttoxeter latest (2m, good); needs hood debuted there to work at least as well again, having been re-raised 2lb for not winning.

quotes.race: British Horse Society Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Iolaos Du Mou will come on a lot for that. He'll go hurdling and we were worried about the ground, but everyone was - John Jarvis, part-owner.

stable_tour.quote: For a start, we all call him Pablo and he was second at Fontwell recently, but I think that will turn out to be a pretty good race and he should be winning over hurdles soon. 30-10-23

runners.name: Dreams Fled Away
runners.comment: Not a happy time of it at Kempton latest (2m, good); gently progressive last autumn.
runners.spotlight: Gradual progression of last autumn has come to something of a halt since, and remains to be seen whether a rough race at Kempton latest (hampered and short of room early, eventually fell) has been got over.

runners.name: Rukaana
runners.comment: Unlucky not to fare a lot better than a 2l second latest (hampered); back up 4lb.
runners.spotlight: 2l second at Market Rasen latest (2m1.5f, good) could have been so much better but for significant hampering on the turn in; live chance if blinkers debuted there work for him again, though 4lb re-raise isn't ideal.

quotes.race: Conferencing And Events At Nottingham Racecourse Handicap (A Jockey Club Grassroots Mile Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I had no plan. Rukaana was a little bit slow away but he's still learning but when the penny dropped he quickened nicely. He should get plenty of confidence from coming through them like that and he's hit the line strongly. He's a big horse but coming here onto good ground suited him and I'd be confident he'd get a mile and a quarter - Christian Howarth, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Boost Your Acca With BetMGM Nursery Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Rukaana is a big lad and, once I got the position I wanted to be in, I was hoping I could set sail early enough because I think he'll stay further. He showed a nice attitude going to the line.  - Ben Curtis, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He came from Charlie Hills on the Flat and will be going juvenile hurdling this season. He's got a really nice attitude to jumping and hopefully he can pick up a couple of nice juvenile races. 06-11-24

runners.name: Now I Know
runners.comment: Temperament often to the fore over hurdles, and initial mark doesn't look a gift.
runners.spotlight: Beaten at least 34l when consenting to jump off over hurdles, often refusing to settle; couldn't put maximum faith in him, even before factoring in a mark which looks stiff even judged on his peak bumper efforts.

runners.name: Mr Le Philosophe
runners.breeder: Societe Civile De L'Ecurie De Meautry
runners.comment: Debut for a yard that can revive one; mark okay, effectiveness on good undetermined.
runners.spotlight: Went badly the wrong way for Rebecca Menzies following the initial promise of his Catterick hurdles debut fourth (2m, soft), on which form effort he's on a fair mark; respected debuting for a yard that can revive one, with all headgear left off; pulled too hard on sole run on good.

stable_tour.quote: We bought him from France and he was very disappointing at the start of the year. The mistake we probably made was trying him as a juvenile hurdler as it didn't work. He was fit and we kept going with him, but sometimes horses from France need time to acclimatise and come to themselves. He's got a lot to prove and has shown nothing since we've had him, but he's a rarity in that his hurdles mark is lower than his Flat one. We're going to try to run him in a handicap hurdle in November after his summer break. If it clicks with him, he could be thrown in. 26-09-24

runners.name: What An Icon
runners.comment: No improvement for the return to assertive tactics when last seen; 5lb out of the weights.
runners.spotlight: No improvement for the return to assertive tactics on her final two outings last summer, beaten 25l in each; 5lb out of the weights on this return to action and not easily recommended.

5:10.race_name: Golf At Gowran Park Optional Claiming Race

runners.name: Feature This
runners.comment: Five-time winner has suffered an alarming decline in form, badly off at the weights here
runners.spotlight: Five-time winner has suffered an alarming decline in form since finishing third in a 1m handicap at Dundalk last November; badly off at the weights here.

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Feature This likes it up here. I was trying to get her to stay further but that's probably her trip. There was not much pace which probably suited her. She battled well and will probably keep going up here for the winter - Paul Flynn, trainer

quotes.race: Join Us On Instagram @dundalk_stadium Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Feature This got a grand ride from Robert, he did everything I asked. I thought she was a bit lairy so we stuck the cheekpieces on her but she did it well - Paul Flynn, trainer.

runners.name: Razzam
runners.comment: 5f winner who has often run well over 6f, weak form on his last four starts in Britain
runners.spotlight: 5f winner in Britain two seasons ago; a long way below his best on his last four starts last year; seems most effective at 6f, though was placed over this trip on AW last year.

runners.name: Roman Harry
runners.comment: Laytown winner last year, second in a Dundak claimer in March, relatively weak turf form
runners.spotlight: Sole win came on the beach at Laytown last year; runner-up in a claimer at Dundalk in March; not disgraced in a 7f handicap at the Curragh last time; however, turf form is relatively weak, 0-15, placed twice.

runners.name: Ina Mina
runners.comment: Has done almost all her racing over longer trips but placed over 7f at Galway last year
runners.spotlight: Has done almost all her racing over longer distances, including over 1m4f on latest; previous fourth over 1m at Limerick was respectable, and she was placed over this trip on heavy ground at Galway last October.

runners.name: Prince Of Eyeries
runners.comment: Won an ordinary Dundalk maiden four starts ago, others preferred on current turf form
runners.spotlight: Won an ordinary Dundalk maiden four starts ago; mid-field on her last two turf outings; needs to find extra.

runners.name: Distillate
runners.owner: Mark Devlin & Nigel Ohare & Philip Smith

prev_owners.owner: N O'Hare/G Devlin/J McCrory/Kabin Racing Syndicate
Nigel O'Hare/Gary Devlin/Joseph McCrory/Kabin Racing Synd

runners.comment: Unplaced in five turf starts this term, stablemate Comfort Line is better treated here
runners.spotlight: Five-time winner; unplaced in five turf starts this season; not a bad effort when seventh of 27 at the Curragh last time; placed in two Dundalk claimers towards the end of last year; others better suited by the race conditions, including stablemate Comfort Line.

quotes.race: Starman At Tally-Ho Handicap
quotes.quote: Distillate has improved all the time. Hopefully the handicapper won't be too hard on her and she should be a good fun filly. We'll probably go back to Dundalk for the winter - Ado McGuinness, trainer

runners.name: Comfort Line
runners.comment: Nine-time winner, has a better record on AW but solid turf form also, definite chance
runners.spotlight: Heavily raced gelding, 9-92, placed 21 times; has a better record on AW than on turf; recorded sixth Dundalk win in March after three consecutive seconds, two of them in claimers; placed over this trip at Leopardstown on penultimate start; official rating (75) gives him every chance here.

quotes.race: Gift & Art Gallery Dundalk Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Comfort Line ate up this morning, did a half-hour on the beach this morning and we decided we had nothing to lose. He's solid and a good fun horse, when he comes back down to this sort of grade he wins - Ado McGuinness, trainer.

quotes.race: www.navanracecourse.ie Handicap
quotes.quote: The handicapper gave Comfort Line a bit of a chance by dropping him a few pounds. I was a bit disappointed at Galway when he had an outside draw and didn't get a chance. He was coming back to form and, all being well, he'll run in the Cambridgeshire in a couple of days. I used the cheekpieces on him (when second) in the Lincoln earlier this year and had been kind of saving them until he was back where I thought he'd be - Mick Mulvany, trainer.

quotes.race: PWC Kilkenny Handicap
quotes.quote: He's a horse I always thought would make up into a nice horse and I think he'll make a far better four-year-old. He's very big and he's filling into his frame. The Irish Lincoln is the plan for him. You'd be hopeful he'll turn into a Lincoln horse - Mick Mulvany, trainer

quotes.race: LimerickRaces.ie Maiden (Div I)
quotes.quote: Leigh Roche came in the last day and said he just didn't stay the mile and a quarter. I always thought he'd be a nice horse and still think he'll get a mile and two furlongs, but he's still only maturing into a horse. He's a big frame of a horse and the breed of them only get better as they get older. You'd be hoping he'll develop into the type of horse we think he is. We'll probably go to Galway after this for a three-year-old race. I'd blame myself for the last few runs and last time we found out for sure he didn't stay a mile and a quarter yet. Gary [Carroll] said today that he felt the horse was idling in front so hopefully he can keep progressing - Mick Mulvany, trainer of Comfort Line

runners.name: Mother Mara
runners.comment: Best effort for Ralph Beckett came over 7f on AW at Wolverhampton, ordinary Irish form
runners.spotlight: Best effort for Ralph Beckett came over 7f on AW at Wolverhampton; ordinary form in three runs for this stable over three different trips.

runners.name: Tofino
runners.comment: Shaped well at the Curragh on her only nursery start, decent pedigree, open to improvement
runners.spotlight: Modest form in maidens at two; positives to be taken from her sole nursery start when a staying-on fourth of 16 over this trip at the Curragh; decent pedigree, open to improvement; market could be informative about her prospects.

runners.name: Akeela
runners.comment: Fair form at a modest level last year highlighted by 6f Naas win, out of form this term
runners.spotlight: Fair form at a modest level last season, highlighted by 6f Naas win and 7f Cork second; no sign of similar form this season.

runners.name: Nezeeh
runners.comment: Had been on a losing run but snapped that when a clearcut winner at Cork on Tuesday
runners.spotlight: Had been on a losing run but snapped that when a clearcut winner at Cork on Tuesday (handicap); with no penalty to carry, he's a likely player if turned out again.

runners.name: Pinball Wizard
runners.comment: Best Irish form over further but 7f winner in Britain, leading chance if fully fit
runners.spotlight: Useful form for this stable in 2023 and 2024, though best over longer distances than this; won over this trip at Chelmsford last autumn, during a spell with James Owen; promising apprentice aboard, leading chance if ready after a break.

runners.name: Rene Artois
runners.comment: Deteriorated after showing promise as a juvenile, has been struggling over hurdles lately
runners.spotlight: 16-race maiden on Flat, poor hurdler; showed early promise for Michael O'Callaghan as a juvenile in 2021; has been struggling over hurdles lately; seems safe to rule out.

runners.name: Reponse Finale
runners.comment: Went close in a 7f maiden at Down Royal last year, flopped when favourite here last month
runners.spotlight: Went close in a 7f maiden at Down Royal last September; no sign of that form since then; flopped when favourite here five weeks ago, rider reported filly had trouble negotiating the first bend; ex-Kevin Prendergast, first start for this stable.

runners.name: Sassy Sox
runners.comment: Failed to build on a satisfactory debut for Gavin Cromwell last year, seasonal/yard debut
runners.spotlight: Failed to build on a satisfactory debut for Gavin Cromwell last year; plenty to prove on seasonal/yard debut

5:45.race_name: Gowran Park Median Auction Fillies Maiden

runners.name: Edge Of Seventeen
runners.comment: Promising run at Naas last August, can be excused Curragh failure,  premature to write off
runners.spotlight: First home in a barrier trial at Leopardstown last August, but still looked raw when keeping on for third on debut in a 7f maiden at  Naas in September; lost her action at the Curragh on her only other start and reported slightly lame post-race; premature to write off.

stable_tour.quote: She won a barrier trial before running really well on her debut at Naas. She ran badly at the Curragh next time but there was an excuse for that as she picked up a little injury. She's back to herself now and she's got ability. She's a half-sister to Albigna. 23-04-25

runners.name: Inventress
runners.comment: Found only one too good at Cork, pedigree implies this shorter trip will not be a problem
runners.spotlight: Well supported on debut in a maiden over an extended 1m2f at Cork 15 days ago and found only one too good; pedigree implies this shorter trip will not be a problem.

runners.name: Its All Peachy
runners.comment: Third of 16 over C&D on seasonal debut, 3l behind Lady Lilac then, needs to improve
runners.spotlight: Best of four maiden runs when third of 16 over C&D on seasonal debut, 3l behind today's rival Lady Lilac; ground was heavy then; mid-field on handicap debut at Naas; reduced official rating of 72 suggests she needs to improve.

runners.name: Lady Lilac
runners.breeder: Robert Ryan, Brendan Quinn & Joan Quinn
runners.comment: Consistent 73-rated filly, in the frame all four starts; has an edge over Its All Peachy
runners.spotlight: Consistent 73-rated maiden, in the frame on all four starts; ground was heavy when runner-up here four weeks ago, 3l in front of Its All Peachy; handled good ground at Bellewstown and also effective on AW.

runners.name: Little Miss P
runners.comment: Half-sister to five winners including stakes-placed Rijeka and the versatile Grey Waters
runners.spotlight: Ninth foal; half-sister to five winners, including the US stakes-placed Rijeka and the versatile Grey Waters; dam won on AW.

runners.name: Luscious
runners.comment: Second over 1m at Bellewstown last July on debut, fair sixth at Leopardstown, may improve
runners.spotlight: Second over 1m at Bellewstown last July on debut, fair sixth at Leopardstown later that month; sister to stable's 5f Listed winner Head Mistress, but her first run indicated stamina.

runners.name: Phoenix Pairc
runners.comment: Seventh foal; half-sister to three winners, dam a four-time minor winner by Cape Cross
runners.spotlight: Seventh foal; half-sister to three winners; dam a four-time minor winner by Cape Cross.

runners.name: Princess Of Saxony
runners.owner: Team Valor International Llc & A Oliver
runners.comment: Unplaced in two 1m maidens at Dundalk late last year, needs to improve to feature here
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in two 1m maidens at Dundalk late last year; needs to improve to feature here.

runners.name: Shrihara
runners.comment: Slowly away and never a threat when 4-1 chance in C&D maiden, different ground, tongue-tie
runners.spotlight: Slowly away and never a threat when 4-1 chance in C&D maiden in which Lady Lilac, Its All Peachy and Staywitherjohnny made the frame; ground was heavy then, may do a lot better on this surface with a tongue-tie fitted.

runners.name: Staywitherjohnny
runners.comment: 80-1 when fourth in C&D maiden in which Lady Lilac and Its All Peachy were placed
runners.spotlight: 80-1 when an encouraging fourth in C&D maiden in which Lady Lilac and Its All Peachy were placed; ground was heavy, could be in the mix if similarly effective on contrasting going now.

runners.name: Western Dreamer
runners.comment: Half-sister to four winners; dam placed, tough task on debut
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; half-sister to four winners; dam placed, half-sister to a North American stakes winner; tough task on debut.

runners.name: Super Fly
runners.comment: No impact in three bumper runs and well held by Pierre Royal on C&D running two weeks ago
runners.spotlight: No impact in three bumper runs; well held by Pierre Royal on C&D running two weeks ago when 250-1 chance for his first run under Flat rules.

runners.name: Bishopton
runners.owner: Nigel Ohare/D W Sloan/Milena C Mocchetti/Kabin Racing Synd
runners.comment: Placed in four of his six starts, fair handicap run on latest but needs to raise his game
runners.spotlight: Placed in four of his six starts, twice on turf in Britain and better when twice runner-up for this stable at Dundalk last December; may improve from a fair fifth in a Naas handicap on seasonal debut, but an official rating of 74 makes him vulnerable.

runners.name: Diamond Cross
runners.comment: Slowly away and always at the back when 200-1 on debut at Navan, safe to rule out
runners.spotlight: Slowly away and always at the back when 200-1 on debut at Navan; safe to rule out.

runners.name: Limbocall
runners.comment: Dam placed 1m is half-sister to 7f Group 2 winner Ansgar, strong trainer/rider combination
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam placed 1m, half-sister to 7f Group 2 winner Ansgar; strong trainer/rider combination.

runners.name: Littlesumpinsumpin
runners.comment: No sign of ability in maidens over longer distances at this venue and Tipperary
runners.spotlight: No sign of ability in maidens over longer distances at this venue and Tipperary.

runners.name: Pierre Royal
runners.comment: Well-related colt made an encouraging debut with second over C&D, very hard to oppose
runners.spotlight: Second foal; half-brother to 1m winner Red Viburnum; dam Rose De Pierre won four of her eight races, including two Listed; made an encouraging debut when splitting the 85-rated First Wave and the 88-rated Daler over C&D a fortnight ago; very hard to oppose.

runners.name: Rising King
runners.comment: Half-brother to four winners, dam 5f/6f AW winner, half-sister to a 5f 2yo Group 3 winner
runners.spotlight: Eighth foal; half-brother to four winners; dam 5f/6f AW winner, half-sister to 5f 2yo Group 3 winner Masta Plasta.

runners.name: Rainbow Sorbet
runners.comment: First foal, dam 7f course winner, Colin Keane on the stable's other runner Limbocall
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam 7f course winner for this stable in 2020, half-sister to 5f winner Newton's Law, out of Listed winner from family of 2,000 Guineas winner Don't Forget Me; Colin Keane on the stable's other runner.

6:50.race_name: Membership At Gowran Park Golf Club Handicap

runners.name: Harry The Rogue
runners.comment: Won two of his last three and 10lb rise is justified for comfortable Killarney success
