runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the 20th attempt in a Naas handicap and bounced back from a lesser run over C&D with a comfortable success at Killarney last week; 10lb rise looks justified and ought to run well with a handy draw.

runners.name: Daymer Bay
runners.comment: 0-15; out of form when last seen on AW; sold for 8,000gns in Oct'; likely best watched
runners.spotlight: 15-race maiden who was out of form when last seen on AW in Britain and bought for 8,000gns in the sales in October; probably best watched on yard debut returning from 219 days off.

runners.name: Skontonovski
runners.comment: In good form for Ado McGuinness at the end of last year but hasn't kicked on for new yard
runners.spotlight: In good form for Ado McGuinness towards the end of last year but hasn't kicked on for his new connections.

quotes.race: Bet On The Best Night Out At Dundalk Stadium Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Skontonovski is better suited by a mile. He travelled everywhere. This track suits him because they fan out and you can go wherever you want with him. I always felt I was going to get there - Ronan Whelan, rider

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Guaranteed Multiples All Shops Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Skontonovski grows a leg around here in that grade. It is a matter of not hitting the front too soon with him - Ronan Whelan, jockey.

quotes.race: DundalkStadium.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Skontonovski is a tricky ride and has to be played late but he is a solid horse in the grade. He has deserved a little break now before we freshen him up. We'll target something nice on the turf with him - Stephen Thorne, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Mallow Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Skontonovski didn't seem to get home at Roscommon. I told Ronnie to hold on to him for as long as he could, I put a visor on and it made a big difference and Ronnie was world class - Ado McGuinness, trainer.

runners.name: Sub Rosa
runners.comment: 10-race maiden and has barely beaten a rival in six starts for her new yard; blinkers on
runners.spotlight: 10-race maiden and has barely beaten a rival in six starts for her new yard; now tried with blinkers.

runners.name: Bungle Inthedesert
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late Mrs Eileen Heanen & Noel Heanen
runners.comment: Both wins at 1m on AW; unsuited by 7f latest; needs to prove he's as good on turf
runners.spotlight: Both wins over a mile at Dundalk, the latest from 6lb lower last month and unsuited by 7f subsequently when beaten 2l; return to further will suit but needs to prove he's as effective on turf.

quotes.race: Friday 12th July Ladies Day At Dundalk Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Bungle Inthedesert was there to be shot at and had plenty to do in the last furlong, but in fairness to him he did it. Thankfully, we stayed in front and he was good and game - Siobhan Rutledge, rider.

runners.name: Hastily
runners.comment: Well held last of 15 over 7f here last month and needs quicker ground than what's likely
runners.spotlight: Well held last of 15 over 7f here last month and probably needs quicker ground than what is likely; back up in trip.

quotes.race: Silver Shine Turf Services Ltd Handicap
quotes.quote: I was lucky to pick up Hastily for 1,000gns, but she's a very big girl. It's a similar story with Coffeemeanscoffee, I suppose ? I picked her up for just 800gns. You need to be patient with these big-framed horses ? some of the bigger yards aren't - Tom McGuinness, trainer.

runners.name: Asisaid
runners.owner: J Leigh & J Orourke & Teresa Leigh & Jenny Curley
runners.comment: Losing run since 2023 but minor signs of a revival over 7f here latest; may build on that
runners.spotlight: Won twice on testing ground in 2023 but losing run since; minor signs of a revival over 7f here last time; well treated if he can build on that and return to further will help at least.

quotes.race: O'Neill & Co. Apprentice Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Asisaid got his ground today and the blinkers helped. When he goes and does it he has plenty of ability. With the ground as it is we might go to Galway - Pat Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: ITBA Next Generation Handicap
quotes.quote: Asisaid was a bit backward physically and mentally. We're delighted with that, we knew he'd do a job but we just didn't think he do it as quickly. He came to hand very quick this year - Pat Murphy, trainer.

runners.name: Shining Aitch

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Caroline Jordan & Mrs Pauline McCourt & Anthony Davitt

runners.comment: More prolific on AW than turf and out of form on AW when last seen; won't want rain
runners.spotlight: More prolific on AW than turf and was struggling for form at Dundalk when last seen; his better turf runs have come on good or quicker ground so probably wants the rain to stay away.

runners.name: Share The Treasure

prev_owners.owner: Mrs D F O'Rourke & Mrs Josephine Hogan & Denis F Howard

runners.comment: 0-12; career best came here over 7f; failed to build on minor promise last time though
runners.spotlight: 0-12 but career best came at this venue when narrowly denied over 7f last summer; didn't back up some minor promise at Cork when well held at Naas 23 days ago and others have stronger profiles.

runners.name: Dolce Far Niente
runners.comment: Narrowly denied over further last summer; didn't kick on; may need this after 212 days off
runners.spotlight: Only narrowly denied over further at Ballinrobe last summer but didn't kick on from that effort and well held when last seen at this venue over similar trip; while she has a career-low mark for her return, there's a suspicion she'll need this after 212 days off.

runners.name: Glencullen
runners.comment: 0-13; beaten fav over C&D on return and now drawn wide
runners.spotlight: 13-race maiden who was a beaten favourite over this C&D on his return to action a fortnight ago finishing fourth of 15; wide draw this time and others appeal more.

runners.name: Marians Gal
runners.comment: 0-14 and best form has come over further than this; likely to need this after 175 days off
runners.spotlight: 0-14 and best form has come over further than this; likely to need this after 175 days off and others preferred.

runners.name: Saxon Kingdom
runners.comment: 9lb better off with Harry The Rogue but slower ground wouldn't play to his strengths
runners.spotlight: Hit the crossbar in two of his last three starts, the latest behind Harry The Rogue at Killarney last week; 9lb better off with that rival now but slower ground may not play to his strengths if the rain arrives.

runners.name: Gianh River
runners.owner: D J Mooney & Barry J Doyle
runners.comment: 0-11 but back to form when 2nd here latest and had an excuse (saddle slipped)
runners.spotlight: 11-race maiden but easily one of his better runs when beaten half a length over C&D a fortnight ago on yard debut; that's worth upgrading given that the saddle slipped and he ought to run well again with the potential of more to come for his new connections.

runners.name: Tynamite
runners.comment: 6-time AW winner; probably needed return but opposable on turf with 0-25 record
runners.spotlight: Six-time AW winner who probably needed last month's return at Dundalk but opposable here with a record of 0-25 on turf, although has run okay on a couple of his previous visits here.

quotes.race: Irish Racing Fundraiser for Children's Health Foundation Crumlin In Memory Of Pat Smullen Handicap
quotes.quote: Tynamite did it well in the end. The step back in trip suited him and he just needs a bit of tricking for to go. Coming between horses helps him - Oisin Orr, rider

quotes.race: LMFM Dual Race Night Friday 3rd May Handicap
quotes.quote: Tynamite was running over his trip today. He needs things to fall right. He got a brilliant ride tonight and he has the ability to win again - David Marnane, trainer.

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: He was always showing a bit of nice work at home but he didn't like soft ground. Both times he's run here he's respectably. We may try and run him next Friday night as long as the handicapper doesn't kill us - Paul McEnery, trainer

runners.name: Famous Enough
runners.comment: 0-12 but respectable return when 5th here; bounce factor a concern
runners.spotlight: 12-race maiden but respectable return from lengthy absence when fifth of 14 a fortnight ago behind re-opposing Gianh River; bounce factor a concern.

runners.name: Top Of The Pops
runners.comment: Gained first win since debut over C&D last month; hasn't backed it up twice since; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; gained first win since debut over this C&D last month but hasn't backed it up twice since.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Reference Point Novice Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Top Of The Pops was really determined to win. He battled very well and was quite impressive on this heavy ground. He's a typical horse from Mark Johnston's stable - once he got his head in front he just kept fighting. He was very professional and the further he goes, the better he will be - Silvestre de Sousa, jockey.

runners.name: Poppadom
runners.comment: 0-21 but went close over a bit further here in October and eyecatching return; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; 21-race maiden but went close over a bit further here in October and eyecatching return.

runners.name: Say Youre Sorry
runners.comment: 12-race maiden and shown nothing in two starts this season; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; 12-race maiden and shown nothing in two starts this season.

runners.name: Lemsairbat
runners.comment: Heavy ground winner in France and big run on yard debut despite wide draw; big player
runners.spotlight: Won on heavy at Compiegne in September and big run on debut for this yard at Sligo earlier this month from a wide draw; return to slower conditions won't be an issue and entitled to come on for that run; big player with a handy draw this time.

runners.name: Elegant Madame
runners.comment: Running well in defeat on AW through the winter; looks up against it on these terms though
runners.spotlight: No wins since debut in 2023 but was running well in defeat on AW through the winter; looks up against it on these terms though.

quotes.race: Royal Ascot Tips On attheraces.com EBF Fillies' Restricted Novice Stakes (Horses In Bands C/D) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Elegant Madame was a bit green early and it took a bit of time to get her balanced. She's a lovely scopey filly who will be much better on the turf over a nice straight seven furlongs or a mile - Kevin Stott, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: We were happy enough with her run in Ireland at Leopardstown earlier in the month. She only beat one home but she hit the line strong. They took her off her feet a little bit early on, she's going to want a little bit further so we'll play it by ear and we might find something over a mile or a mile and one this season. She might go to Newmarket for the Zetland Stakes. She'll stay well and was doing all her best work late on at Lingfield. I think she's a very nice filly in the making and the further she goes the better she'll be. 21-09-23

runners.name: Deressa
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Progressive and off the mark in C&D maiden latest when beating a nice prospect
runners.spotlight: Progressive filly who was a close-up fourth in a C&D maiden in October before winning a C&D fillies' maiden on last month's return, getting the better of a well bred Ballydoyle runner that was odds on; will be involved if she progresses again.

runners.name: Donna Nook
runners.comment: Left debut behind with 7f AW win; well held on h'cap debut but should come on for that
runners.spotlight: Left her debut behind with 7f Dundalk success in December but was well held on her handicap debut earlier this month; she may come on for that run and every chance further will suit given her pedigree; respected.

runners.name: Gotomylovely
runners.owner: Mrs M V Magnier & Mrs Paul Shanahan
runners.comment: Major step forward to win 1m maiden here but didn't back it up in Listed class latest
runners.spotlight: Major step forward to win a 1m maiden here by 6l but didn't back it up when only beating one home in a Listed race at Naas earlier this month; return to slower ground needs to spark a revival.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies & Mares Maiden
quotes.quote: Gotomylovely is straightforward but she got stage fright the first day in Dundalk and then ran well in a maiden. The last day wasn't anything to do with her, the bit went through her mouth and she didn't know what to do. I tried to use her experience out in front and she quickened up smartly in the straight. I gave her her own space and she's showed us in her work at home that she quite likes that. There's an engine there - Joey Sheridan, jockey.

runners.name: Bellacanta
runners.comment: Eyecatching 40-1 debut; possibly one for longer distances and this looks tough
runners.spotlight: Eyecatching 40-1 debut when staying on well to finish fifth of 20 in a Navan (1m2f, soft) maiden last month; may be one for longer distances given that her full-sister was a stayer on the Flat and this is probably a stiff task second time out.

runners.name: Sulya
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Plenty to like about her pedigree but big ask on debut and Hayes prefers Deressa
runners.spotlight: Pinatubo filly; half-sister to winners Sumiha (1m2f/1m4f including Group 3; RPR 108) and Suwayra (1m 2yo; 91); dam Group-placed 1m2f winner (95), half-sister to 1m Group 3 winner Sinawann and 2m Listed winner Silwana, out of half-sister to Derby/Arc winner Sinndar; plenty to like about her pedigree but big ask on debut and Hayes prefers Deressa.

runners.name: Treasure Rose
runners.comment: Inns Of Court filly; 50,000eur yearling; helf-sister to Group 3 winner; tough ask on debut
runners.spotlight: Inns Of Court filly; cost 50,000eur as a yearling; half-sister to 7f/1m4f winner Caught U Looking (including 2yo Group 3; RPR 104); dam unraced half-sister to winners Mix And Mingle (7f Group 3) and Double Or Bubble (6f/7f Group 3); needs to be a long way above average to land this on debut.

7:50.race_name: Robert Grace Live After Racing June 2nd Handicap

runners.name: Empress Alma

prev_owners.owner: E Hughes & Carmel Yore & Darren Cahill & Kiva Cromwell

runners.comment: Progressive since h'capping, winning thrice last term; 6lb higher for return
runners.spotlight: Progressive since handicapping, winning twice last summer before signing off the campaign with a Thurles win in October; 6lb higher for return but drop back in trip is fine and yard can ready one; market may give clues.

quotes.race: Care At Home Services Handicap
quotes.quote: Empress Alma is a good sized filly and I think she'll improve again going 1m4f. Hopefully she can step forward from that and win again - Gary Carroll, rider.

runners.name: Sioux Eagle
runners.comment: 0-10; consistent and respectable C&D 4th latest when slowly away; down 1lb; may do better
runners.spotlight: 10-race maiden but he's fairly consistent and respectable fourth over C&D on return to the Flat last month; slowly away that day and may do better here; dropped 1lb.

runners.name: Party Dress
runners.comment: 1m1f winner but respectable Curragh return and should have more to give at this trip
runners.spotlight: Flat win came in a 1m1f maiden but has won over timber since and she was only beaten roughly 4l at the Curragh on return; low-key hurdle run since but should have more to give at this sort of trip on the level.

runners.name: Gracesolution
runners.comment: Gained first win since 2022 2 starts ago and shaped like return to further may help since
runners.spotlight: Gained a first win since 2022 in a 1m4f six-runner Dundalk handicap on penultimate start and shaped like a return to further may help back at Dundalk since; best form on quicker ground than what's likely.

quotes.race: William Hill Top Price Guarantee Handicap
quotes.quote: I thought I had got up, it was nip and tuck. Gracesolution had a nice run here the last day and she likes to run fresh. She needs cover, I was delighted with the lack of pace and was there ready to pounce. I knew she had a good turn of foot, I was trying to nurse her for as long as I could, she got there and parked a little bit -Donagh O'Connor, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

quotes.race: Lake Isle Of Innisfree Handicap
quotes.quote: Gracesolution was a little bit harder on herself and maybe she has learned to race a bit better now, so you wouldn't mind stepping her up in trip a little bit, maybe up to 1m4f at some point - Ross O'Sullivan, trainer.

runners.name: Miss Gitana
runners.comment: Won twice over this trip in Britain and better than result in only Flat run for this yard
runners.spotlight: Won twice over this sort of trip for Sir Mark Prescott; hasn't really taken to hurdles for her new yard but she was better than the result when eighth of 18 in a 1m5f Navan handicap last month; not ruled out.

runners.name: Star Official
runners.comment: Arrives on the back of career best h'cap hurdle success; went close when last seen on Flat
runners.spotlight: Arrives on the back of a career best handicap hurdle success; big run from 4lb lower when last seen on the Flat at Galway in 2023 and one to be interested.

runners.name: Dancing Steve
runners.comment: 1m1f winner from 7lb lower; placed in trio of AW h'caps in winter; stamina to prove though
runners.spotlight: 1m1f winner from 7lb lower in September and hit the frame in trio of Dundalk handicaps before a lesser run when last seen in December; sole run at this sort of trip was underwhelming and he's been off 154 days.

runners.name: Lady Kai
runners.comment: Progressed since h'capping winning twice last term; fair form at this trip; off 210 days
runners.spotlight: Progressed since handicapping, winning twice over middle distances from four runs last season; has run with credit without winning in two starts at this sort of trip but has been off 210 days and may not want rain to arrive.

runners.name: Disco Boy
runners.comment: 0-9; encouraging h'cap debut over 1m5f; dropped 1lb and extra furlong should help
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden (inc' five runs in bumpers); encouraging handicap debut over 1m5f and dropped 1lb; extra furlong here can only help and one for the shortlist.

runners.name: Pons Aelius
runners.comment: Best form at 2m; hasn't kicked on in 2 runs for new yard; wins have come on faster ground
runners.spotlight: Best form in Britain came over 2m and hasn't kicked on in two runs for new yard at big prices; wins have come on quicker ground than what's likely here.

runners.name: Inchiquin Star
runners.comment: 0-19 on Flat and well held on last week's return at Roscommon; needs to leave that behind
runners.spotlight: 0-19 on the Flat and well held on last week's return at Roscommon; needs to leave that behind.

runners.name: Makaiah

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Lynne Lyons & Sean Jones & David Spratt

runners.comment: Off the mark at 10th attempt on Saturday; good claimer help offset 7lb rise
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the tenth attempt on the level with a Navan win on Saturday; carries a 7lb penalty but Sam Coen has made a promising start to his career and his 7lb claim should help negate the rise.

runners.name: Red Secret
runners.comment: Both wins on AW; entitled to come on for Saturday's return behind Makaiah
runners.spotlight: Both wins on AW and well held behind Makaiah on Saturday; entitled to come on for that but it's a quick turnaround; possible a return to further will help though.

runners.name: Dumb Love
runners.comment: Losing run on Flat but won't mind cut in the ground and new trip worth a go
runners.spotlight: Losing run on the Flat since a heavy ground Bellewstown maiden in 2023 when trained by Ger Lyons; wouldn't mind cut in the ground if the rain arrives and well worth a go at this trip given that she won over timber earlier in the year.

quotes.race: Roxyfet Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Dumb Love is rated 60-odd on the Flat and runs over a mile and a quarter, so I knew she'd have the pace. A good friend of mine works for Ger, so he told me all about her. He said 'don't be hanging around, drive her on from the top of the hill' and he was right - Brian Hughes, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Ratoathvets.ie Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: Dumb Love loved the soft ground and saw out the mile well. The blinkers sharpened her up today, the plan was to jump and be forward enough. I got an easy enough lead which suited her and she battled it out well - Jack Kearney, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Black Soul
runners.comment: Maiden hurdle winner latest; 0-13 on Flat but well worth another go at this trip
runners.spotlight: Followed up a point win last month with a maiden hurdle success 16 days ago; 0-13 on the level but went close at Navan in October and well worth another go at this trip; Keane an eyecatching jockey booking.

runners.name: Fine Print
runners.comment: Back-to-back winner at Wolverhampton prior to Saturday's 2nd to Makaiah
runners.spotlight: Won back-to-back at Wolverhampton before a 2l defeat to Makaiah on Saturday; better off with at the weights with that rival now and won't mind the return to further.

runners.name: Omakase
runners.comment: Off the mark over 1m4f on AW and creditable runs twice since; needs to prove as good at 2m
runners.spotlight: Off the mark with a 1m4f success at Dundalk in February and creditable efforts in defeat on AW since; acts with cut in the ground and switch to turf won't be an issue but needs to prove she's as good at this trip.

runners.name: Futurum Regem
runners.comment: Struggling for form over jumps; well held on most recent Flat outing too
runners.spotlight: Struggling for form over jumps when last seen and well held at Navan on most recent Flat outing; likely to need this first run since January.

quotes.race: Tara Handicap Hurdle (Grade B)
quotes.quote: Futurum Regem is a little horse and just seems to be improving the whole time. He likes good ground and the light weight suited him - Hugh Finegan, trainer.

runners.name: Kings Prince
runners.comment: Dual winner on turf a while ago; tailed off last 3 Flat starts and has been off
runners.spotlight: Dual winner on turf in Britain in 2020 and 2021 but finished tailed off on last three Flat starts and likely to need this after 231 days off.

quotes.race: Visit racingtv.com EBF Novice Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Kings Prince is a nice horse. He's a big baby who will get stronger as he gets more streetwise - Franny Norton, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He was a backward juvenile and did well to win last autumn over a mile in testing ground at Haydock. He has a big pedigree and will need 1m2f at least this season. 18-04-21

runners.name: Snag It
runners.comment: No wins since 2023 and probably needs further than this; likely best watched on yard debut
runners.spotlight: No wins since 2023 and probably needs a bit further than this; likely best watched on yard debut returning from 110 days off.

runners.name: Bynx
runners.comment: Hasn't managed to get involved in 3 runs since returning to the Flat and others preferred
runners.spotlight: Hasn't managed to get involved in three runs since returning to the Flat and others arrive in better form.

quotes.race: Jimmy Shanahan Memorial Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: When in doubt, call Flanagan! He gave Bynx a masterclass of a ride and got the fractions spot on in that ground - Martin Hassett, trainer.

runners.name: You Make Me Smile
runners.owner: T & R Hennessy & A Fahy Partnership
runners.comment: Followed up hurdle win with Flat win at Sligo and 2lb better off with that rival
runners.spotlight: Followed up her first hurdle success with a Flat win at Sligo 17 days ago with Makaiah in behind who has won since; 2lb better off with that rival this time and should go well again.

runners.name: Duke Otto
runners.comment: 0-11 in this sphere but there's a suspicion he's well treated
runners.spotlight: Hasn't been matching the level of his hurdle form on the Flat and 0-11 in this sphere but there's a suspicion he's well treated.

runners.name: Jumbo Treasure
runners.comment: Early career breakthrough in March; remains open to further progress; contender
runners.spotlight: Early career breakthrough when scoring over today's trip at Sha Tin in March; backed that up with a respectable effort since and remains open to significant further progress; contender.

runners.name: Run Run Smart
runners.comment: Close 3rd in January but subsequent five runs have been disappointing
runners.spotlight: A close third on second local start; subsequent five runs have been disappointing; revival required to figure.

runners.name: Bunta Baby
runners.owner: Chu Tak Wing, Casey Chu Yin Ling & Ronald Chu Tak Wah
runners.comment: Improved effort over C&D last month; still plenty more needed to challenge today
runners.spotlight: Improved effort when a creditable sixth over C&D last month; still plenty more needed to seriously challenge today.

runners.name: Endued
runners.comment: Fair fourth over C&D in March, but two lesser efforts have followed; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Has shown glimmers of hope since arriving in Hong Kong, notably when a fair fourth over C&D in March, but two lesser efforts have followed.

runners.name: Top To Sky
runners.comment: Has shown only limited ability in recent barrier trials; set a tough task today
runners.spotlight: Has shown only limited ability in recent barrier trials; set a tough task from stall 12 on debut.

runners.name: Metal King
runners.comment: Not entirely disgraced on debut and was beaten roughly the same distance last time
runners.spotlight: Not entirely disgraced on debut and was beaten roughly the same distance when finishing fourth over C&D at the end of last month; remains early days.

runners.name: New Power
runners.owner: Cheung Tin Chai, Cheung Shu Yan & Cheung Shu Tak
runners.comment: Consistently knocking on the door throughout this term; overdue another victory
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner last season and consistently knocking on the door throughout this term; overdue another victory, major contender.

runners.name: Exceed The Wish
runners.comment: Improving gradually in five starts since the turn of the year; more still needed
runners.spotlight: Improving gradually in five starts since the turn of the year; further step forward still needed to seriously threaten.

runners.name: Iron Legion
runners.owner: The Hon & Mrs Kenneth Lau Ip Keung
runners.comment: Safely held in four outings so far; impossible to recommend
runners.spotlight: Safely held in four outings so far; impossible to recommend.

runners.name: Shotgun
runners.comment: Career-best effort when fifth over C&D two weeks ago; potentially has more to offer
runners.spotlight: Career-best effort when fifth over C&D two weeks ago; lightly raced and potentially has more to offer; not dismissed.

runners.name: Autumn Delight
runners.comment: Posted a pleasing seasonal return but failed to build on that effort latest
runners.spotlight: Posted a pleasing seasonal return but failed to build on that effort when down the field at Sha Tin latest; others preferred.

runners.name: Noble Go
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Tony Tang Wai Bun, Vicky Tang & Vivian Tang
runners.comment: Generally modest in five starts so far; likely to need a drop in grade
runners.spotlight: Generally modest in five starts so far; likely to need a drop in grade to become competitive.

runners.name: Matters Most
runners.comment: Yet to threaten in ten local outings; readily opposed if making the line-up
runners.spotlight: Yet to threaten in ten local outings; readily opposed if making the line-up.

quotes.race: Byerley Stud British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We hadn't got Matters Most on the grass before his first run and he was green and got squeezed, but today he was very professional. He wants a sixth furlong and I don't know where we'll go, but there might be a race at Pontefract coming up, which could suit him. He's very straightforward and we like him. He's out of a Pastoral Pursuits mare so he's bred to handle this ground, but he moves like he'd handle quicker ground and I've have no qualms about trying him on a faster surface - Ralph Beckett, trainer.

runners.name: Yodas Choice
runners.owner: Alan Lee Yu Sing & Estate Of The Late Lee Kwok Kay
runners.comment: Made belated breakthrough in March; struggled off higher mark since
runners.spotlight: Made belated breakthrough when scoring over 1m1f on Sha Tin dirt in March; struggled off higher mark in three subsequent starts; more required.

runners.name: Confringo
runners.comment: Broke his duck in February but struggled in better company since; back down in grade today
runners.spotlight: Broke his duck over C&D in February but has struggled to make an impact off a higher mark in better company since; today's drop in grade should help his chances.

runners.name: Smiling Emperor
runners.comment: Narrowly defeated over C&D in March; returns to a more realistic level today
runners.spotlight: Went close to a breakthrough victory when narrowly defeated over C&D in March; two subsequent Class 4 runs disappointing, but returns to a more realistic level today.

runners.name: Apolar Fighter
runners.comment: Yet to strike in 13 local starts; recent efforts have been underwhelming
runners.spotlight: Yet to strike in 13 local starts but has shown glimmers of hope this season, notably when a fair foufth over C&D in January; recent efforts have been underwhelming.

runners.name: Windicator Family
runners.owner: Thomas Poon Ho Wing & Poon Chi Keung
runners.comment: Made his belated breakthrough on his penultimate start; strong contender again
runners.spotlight: Made his belated breakthrough with a determined C&D win on his penultimate start; respectable effort off revised mark last time; strong contender again.

runners.name: U S S Constitution
runners.comment: Disappointed when dropped into this grade latest; significant improvement required
runners.spotlight: Yet to seriously threaten in 14 local starts; disappointed when dropped into this grade latest; significant improvement required.

quotes.race: Ascot Iron Stand Membership British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We might look to throw  U S S CONSTITUTION in at the deep end next time. He's a lovely horse and I think he's the sort to be better when he's in a better class of race too - Ed Walker, trainer.

runners.name: Ninja Derby
runners.breeder: T E Luke, Kim & Peter McKay & Waika
runners.owner: Wilson Chan Wai Kwok, Joseph Yim Wai Ho & Gary Ng Ka Wai
runners.comment: Encouraging frame finish in March but recent outings have been disappointing
runners.spotlight: Recorded back-to-back wins either side of season break; encouraging frame finish in March but recent outings have been disappointing; revival required.

runners.name: Verbier
runners.comment: Front-running C&D winner last month; unable to sustain effort under same tactics latest
runners.spotlight: Front-running C&D winner last month, unable to sustain the effort under same tactics latest; revised mark demands further improvement.

runners.name: Perfect Peach
runners.comment: Largely disappointing this term despite promising return in September; risky at present
runners.spotlight: Gained his second career win on final outing last season; largely disappointing this term despite promising return in September; risky at present.

runners.name: Sterling Wongchoy
runners.comment: Longstanding maiden who was narrowly denied at Sha Tin in January; disappointing since
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden who was narrowly denied at Sha Tin in January; disappointing since so needs to bounce back quickly.

runners.name: Miles Away
runners.comment: Yet to make any serious impact in ten career starts; continues to slide down the weights
runners.spotlight: Yet to make any serious impact in ten career starts; continues to slide down the weights.

runners.name: Cool Blue
runners.breeder: B J Lindsay Mnzm & Mrs J E A Lindsay
runners.comment: Snapped a losing streak with a C&D success two weeks ago; capable off revised mark
runners.spotlight: Snapped a losing streak with a C&D success two weeks ago; 7lb higher now but remains competitively weighted based on past placed efforts; considered.

runners.name: Medic Elite
runners.comment: On a lengthy losing run but posted a fair effort last month; may play a part
runners.spotlight: On a lengthy losing run but posted a fair effort when making the frame over C&D last month; potentially well treated if building on that run.

runners.name: Decrelot
runners.owner: Hk Football Club Horse Racing Syndicate
runners.comment: Disappointing in seven career outings so far; impossible to recommend in current form
runners.spotlight: Disappointing in seven career outings so far; impossible to recommend in current form.

runners.name: Harrys Hero
runners.comment: Off the mark in December; close second on his penultimate outing; considered
runners.spotlight: Off the mark when scoring over 7f at Sha Tin in December, again ran well when finishing a close second on his penultimate outing; considered if getting a run.

runners.name: Thesis
runners.comment: Does not win often (1-20) but missed by a short head over C&D off 2lb lower last time.
runners.spotlight: Has a modest Hong Kong win strike-rate of 1-20 but got the strong pace he needs when denied by a short head (two of these rivals behind) over C&D two weeks ago; claims again off 2lb higher.

quotes.race: Britannia Stakes (Heritage Handicap) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Thesis won off 90 today, he's heading towards 100 now. I think he's a good horse. He was the biggest horse in the field; he's got scope and size, so hopefully he can progress - Harry Charlton, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Written Casa

prev_owners.owner: Mrs L Lloyd, M H Wood Et Al

runners.comment: All seven runs this term (including win off 4lb lower) over 6f; Purton takes over on top.
runners.spotlight: Down in class and up in trip; has struggled in four 6f Class 3 races (though only beaten by 2.25l the last twice) since 6f win in February; longer distance is a big unknown; Purton booked for the first time.

runners.name: Turin Warrior
runners.comment: Three-time C&D winner; may be a tad too high in the weights (2.25l fifth the last twice).
runners.spotlight: Triple C&D scorer, most recently off 3lb lower mark in January; only beaten by 2.25l in fifth in both his last two runs but needs a career best to get back to winning ways.

runners.name: Flying Wrote
runners.owner: Simon Tsang Heung Tung & Shirley Tsang Huang Yang
runners.comment: 6f winner who was 1.75l fourth over C&D off this mark on first try beyond 7f last time.
runners.spotlight: Only success came off 4lb lower mark 11 months ago (6f); first try at this trip brought 1.75l C&D fourth two weeks ago; could go well again if his stamaina holds out.

runners.name: Figopumpkin
runners.owner: Dr Edwin Lam Chi Wan & Jason Lam Che Man
runners.comment: Long odds and has never got competitive in two starts thus far; improvement needed.
runners.spotlight: Returned at odds of 70-1 and 93-1 when finishing towards rear on both career starts (this C&D last time); hard to make a case for here off 2lb lower mark.

runners.name: Leslie
runners.comment: On 20-race losing run; unproven at trip; two recent staying-on fourths over 7f give hope.
runners.spotlight: Winless since 2023 and has never managed better than fifth in just three tries at this trip; however, was nearest at finish when fourth in two recent 7f events and has come down to a decent mark.

runners.name: Celestial Patch
runners.comment: No real promise during three 7f outings to kick off his career; up in trip.
runners.spotlight: Massive odds in all three starts to date and has run accordingly; needs this step up from 7f to unlock significant improvement.

runners.name: Soaring Bronco
runners.breeder: Hallmark Stud Ltd & Trevor Hurley Trust
runners.owner: Simon Yung Yun Sang, Tang Ka Nin Et Al
runners.comment: In top form; followed Sha Tin win off 10lb lower with three good efforts; 1-19 win ratio.
runners.spotlight: Broke duck at 16th try in March (1m, Sha Tin); three solid efforts off revised mark since so should go well again today; may not be the doughtiest battler.

runners.name: Owners Praise
runners.comment: Dual 7f scorer; hinted at an upturn with C&D second; lesser effort last time.
runners.spotlight: Dual 7f Sha Tin winner off slightly higher marks; only place in last 11 starts when 1.5l second as a 43-1 outsider over C&D last month; never a factor on latest run.

runners.name: Gallant Crown
runners.comment: Veteran who has lost his form badly since February victory; usual blinkers removed.
runners.spotlight: Old stager with five C&D successes to his name; landed first win since 2023 at Sha Tin in February but form has nosedived since; blinkers (on for all wins) removed.

runners.name: California Moxie
runners.comment: Followed 15 defeats with 0.5l C&D success; upped 5lb; 3lb claimer booked
runners.spotlight: Twice beaten at short odds before finally delivering (at 16th attempt) by 0.5l over C&D three weeks ago; 5lb rise offset by 3lb claiming rider.

runners.name: Lucky Banner
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Stephen Ho Wai Man, F Ho Ka Chun & D Ho Ka Chung
runners.comment: Last five efforts have been off key; runner-up off higher marks three times in late 2024.
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who is on a 26-race win drought; recent runs have been disappointing but is well handicapped if back to the form that saw him finish second three times in the autumn.

runners.name: Ace Power
runners.owner: Chan Ngan Chi & Chen Yung Hung
runners.comment: Managed a 6f triumph in March; two lesser efforts since; looks like a sprinter; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Notched second 6f win off 5lb lower mark in March but has run just okay in both tries since; unlikely to be suited by this jump in distance.

runners.name: Bright Inheritance
runners.owner: 23/24 Dennis C H Yip Trainer Syndicate

prev_owners.owner: Darby Racing, A R Burfoot Et Al
Darby Racing, G Bachell Et Al

runners.comment: Made sudden return to form with Sha Tin success last time; raised 6lb; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Bounced back to form after string of modest efforts with 1l score last time (1m, Sha Tin); 6lb higher here.

runners.name: Supreme Agility
runners.owner: Rotary Club Of Sha Tin Syndicate
runners.comment: Down to Class 4; has managed one third in 16 tries since arriving from Brazil.
runners.spotlight: Group 1 winner in Brazil; down to Class 4 for the first time after 16 local defeats; placed on dirt in October; nine modest runs since, including 5.5l 11th of 14 at Sha Tin on Sunday.

runners.name: Mighty Commander

prev_owners.owner: A Boyd, P M Gangemi & Talinga Girls

runners.comment: Struggled in Class 3 after January C&D win; good third on return to this grade last time.
runners.spotlight: C&D winner off just 2lb lower in January and best run since when 1.25l third here two weeks ago (holds Stormi and Deal Completed on that form); major player.

runners.name: Simple Hedge
runners.comment: Has lost his mojo; well treated on his best form but that was in 2023.
runners.spotlight: Current losing sequence stretches back to July 2023; last four starts have been poor but showed some signs of a renaissance at the turn of the year; well weighted if reviving.

runners.name: Stormi
runners.comment: Flat performance last time following decent C&D third; should not be given up on just yet.
runners.spotlight: Only real encouragement in eight runs since arriving from Ireland when 1.5l third over C&D last month; failed to back that up last time but still has age on his side.

quotes.race: Patton Race
quotes.quote: Bergamasco is a big, honest horse that loves a gallop. He has thrived up here, obviously gets a mile well and likes the surface. I think he is a good advertisement for what we do with a relatively small team of horses - Jack Davison, trainer

runners.name: Dashing Dragon
runners.owner: Chow Yun Sheung & Julian Chow Yushien

prev_owners.owner: Newgate Bloodstock, China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd Et Al

runners.comment: Six poor sprint runs thus far; needs switch to 1m55y to unlock major improvement.
runners.spotlight: Nothing in his first six starts suggests that he will be competitive here, though step up from 6f could bring significant progress.

runners.name: Red Majesty
runners.breeder: S A G Coombe & Haunui Farm Lp
runners.owner: Pong Kin Yee, Samson Yip Yan Tion Et Al
runners.comment: Veteran with nine C&D wins to his name; well treated if six-week break has revived him.
runners.spotlight: Nine-time C&D winner and, although unplaced in all seven 2025 starts, is now 9lb lower than when beaten by a neck on Boxing Day; back from six weeks off; has gone well fresh in the past.

runners.name: Dragon Star
runners.comment: Sure to be well fancied after three near-misses; up another 2lb for latest nose defeat.
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner who has been beaten by 0.5l or less when second in each of his last three runs; is edging back up the handicap and is closely matched with old rival Atomic Beauty.

runners.name: Deal Completed
runners.comment: Shock September 7f win looking like a fluke given how poor his seven other runs have been.
runners.spotlight: Began the season with a shock 35-1 win (7f, Sha Tin) but five dismal efforts since then and has changed trainers twice in the meantime.

runners.name: Atomic Beauty
runners.breeder: Gestut Zur Kuste Ag & Riviera Equine
runners.comment: Often involved in the finish; local strike rate is 2-37; closely matched with Dragon Star.
runners.spotlight: Often runs well, though has been beaten in 35 of his 37 Hong Kong starts; short head behind Dragon Star last time; latest of two C&D wins came offf 3lb higher mark.

quotes.race: KPMG Champions Juvenile Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Atomic Jones is a real horse for next year over a mile plus. He's a big huge baby and I didn't expect to be running him this year, never mind winning two - Ger Lyons, trainer.

quotes.race: Barronstown Stud Irish EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Atomic Jones came here a big raw horse but obviously he was good enough to do that. Colin said he loved the ground and he will be a trip horse for next year - Shane Lyons, trainer.

runners.name: Jumbo Fortune
runners.comment: Well handicapped; rare winner but conditions suits; things will fall his way one day soon.
runners.spotlight: Has won only one of his 55 local races but is now 27lb lower than for that solitary victory and has been in the top four in five of his last six starts (all over this C&D).

runners.name: To Infinity
runners.owner: Chan Wing Chiu & Yildiz Choi Yat Fan
runners.comment: Five-time C&D scorer who has run poorly on all seven 2025 outings.
runners.spotlight: Five times a C&D winner but has been way below his best since notching the last of them (off 3lb higher mark) on Boxing Day.

runners.name: Cosmo Navigator
runners.comment: Has lost his form badly in recent weeks and is highly unlikely to stay this trip.
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the 16th attempt in December but his last four efforts have been poor and has never raced over further than 6f.

runners.name: Lucky Impact
runners.comment: Disappointing apart from a fair 1m dirt fourth two starts ago; 2lb lower here; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Only encouraging run from nine career tries was his 1l fourth as a 33-1 chance (1m, dirt) two starts ago; lesser effort last time, hence he was dropped 2lb.

runners.name: Yiu Cheung Victory
runners.comment: Struggling to convert his useful Macau form to Hong Kong; up from 7f; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Won six times in Macau but yet to find his feet in seven Hong Kong appearances (6f & 7f; best was a 3.5l sixth off 6lb higher mark).

1:40.race_name: Sports Club Diamond Jubilee Challenge Cup (Handicap) (Class 4) (3yo+) (Course C) (Turf)

runners.name: Happy United
runners.comment: Yet to win this season but ran quite well when fifth from stall 10 over C&D last month
runners.spotlight: Yet to win this season but ran quite well when fifth from stall 10 over C&D last month; has better draw today and continues to edge down the weights; considered each-way.

runners.name: Sergeant Pepper
runners.comment: Out of form since December and needs to turn a corner
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner in early part of this season but generally very disappointing since December; needs to turn a corner.

runners.name: Harmony Fire
runners.comment: Regressive 7yo; drawn wide today; needs big boost from today's headgear switch
runners.spotlight: Didn't run badly when sixth over C&D on latest outing two months ago but this regressive 7yo is drawn much wider today and needs a big boost from the first-time blinkers (usually wears cheekpieces).

runners.name: Majestic Delight
runners.comment: Unexposed 3yo; raced too freely over 6f this month; this drop to 5f could be a good move
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 3yo who was placed over 6f here last month, his second start; slightly below that form after racing too freely here a fortnight ago but this drop to 5f could be a good move.

runners.name: Szeryng
runners.breeder: B J Lindsay & Mrs J E Lindsay
runners.owner: Dr Edwin Lam Chi Wan & Jason Lam Che Man
runners.comment: Makes official debut after a very underwhelming trial and is drawn on the outside
runners.spotlight: Out of a 6f winner; makes official debut after a very underwhelming trial and is drawn on the outside.

runners.name: Lean Master
runners.owner: Cheng Wan Wai & Cheng Tsz Yan
runners.comment: Largely consistent front-runner; on a workable mark; can make a bold bid
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who has largely been consistent this season (5f-7f); on a workable mark; no surprise if he makes a bold bid.

runners.name: La Momento
runners.comment: Struggled to get competitive on his first two starts (6f/5f)
runners.spotlight: Struggled to get competitive on his first two starts (6f/5f).

runners.name: Spicy Spangle
runners.comment: Scored over C&D in March and both subsequent 6f runs were perfectly respectable
runners.spotlight: Led close home to score over C&D in March and both subsequent 6f runs were perfectly respectable; drops back in trip today and ought to be on the premises again.

runners.name: Victorythirtythree
runners.comment: Bounced back to form with C&D third last month and has good draw today
runners.spotlight: Suffered dip in form after making all over C&D in October but bounced back with a good third here last month and, from stall 3, he's a contender if in the same mood again.

runners.name: Happy Boys
runners.owner: David Tse Sik Hung, Allison Tse Pui Shan & Q Tse Pui Ching
runners.comment: Showed some improvement last time but needs another good step forward today
runners.spotlight: Displayed some improvement when eighth over C&D last month, his third run, but needs another good step forward to overcome wide draw today.

runners.name: Savvy Twinkle
runners.owner: Julian Hui Chun Hang & Michele Monique Reis
runners.comment: Ran big race in defeat over C&D last month; Zac Purton moves in for the ride today
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo who suggested his turn is near when running big race in defeat over C&D last month (first-time cheekpieces); not ideally drawn today but Zac Purton moves in for the ride; must be considered.

runners.name: Day Day Victory
runners.owner: Alan Kiang Ping Fai & Joyce Lee
runners.comment: In-form 4yo who is on a hat-trick after two Class 5 C&D wins; up in grade today
runners.spotlight: In-form 4yo who is on a hat-trick after two Class 5 C&D wins; has more on his plate in this higher grade but still enters calculations.

runners.name: No Other Choice
runners.breeder: Bred To Win Thoroughbreds Pty Ltd
runners.owner: Cheng Chung Wah & Enzo Cheng Tin Hang
runners.comment: Displayed significant promise in recent trials; tongue-tie fitted for debut
runners.spotlight: Out of a dam placed over 6f and 7f; displayed significant promise in recent trials; will be making his official debut with a tongue-tie fitted if he gets a run today.

runners.name: Thriving Brothers
runners.owner: Yeung Chun Wang, Yeung Ho Wang & Yeung Chung Wang
runners.comment: Ran well over 5f on recent stable debut and today's extra furlong is sure to suit
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent for Douglas Whyte in first half of this season but made very encouraging stable debut when close sixth over 5f at Sha Tin last month and is sure to be suited by this move back up in trip; well drawn; shortlisted.

runners.name: Super Sixty
runners.comment: Has won two of his last three (6f/5f) and could plausibly still be on the upgrade
runners.spotlight: Opened account with C&D win in February, his 12th start, and doubled his tally over 5f last month; latest 6lb rise demands more from him but he could plausibly still be on the upgrade.

runners.name: Prime Mortar
runners.comment: Placed three times over C&D this season but his record is very mixed; drawn wide today
runners.spotlight: Placed three times over C&D this season but his record is very mixed and his wide draw makes things awkward today.

runners.name: Candlelight Dinner
runners.comment: Front-runner; yet to be placed in Hong Kong but has good draw today; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who is yet to be placed after eight Hong Kong starts; switches back to turf after two dirt runs, though, and is well drawn to attack; not ruled out.

runners.name: Gameplayer Elite
runners.owner: Lam Yau Pik, Rex Lam Lam & Monica Lam Mung Ni
runners.comment: 0-10 in Hong Kong but has made the frame over C&D on last two outings; each-way claims
runners.spotlight: 0-10 in Hong Kong but has made the frame over C&D on last two outings and seems to have found his level now; each-way claims at least.

runners.name: Loving Vibes
runners.breeder: G S A Bloodstock Pty Ltd
runners.comment: Came good with C&D win three weeks ago; Zac Purton maintains the partnership
runners.spotlight: Came good at 12th attempt, with ridden-out success over C&D three weeks ago; Zac Purton maintains the partnership today; further progress possible.

runners.name: Nebraskan
runners.owner: Kenneth Lam Sze Ken, Timothy Junior Lam & T Fok Kwong Hang

prev_owners.owner: TFI Diamond Syndicate & Mrs L Fung

runners.comment: Placed over C&D on last three appearances and warrants serious consideration from stall 1
runners.spotlight: 0-17 in Hong Kong but was placed over C&D on last three appearances and warrants serious consideration from the plum inside stall today.

runners.name: Gallant Rex
runners.comment: Recent trials have been fairly encouraging but he's best watched on this official debut
runners.spotlight: Out of a 7f winner; recent trials have been fairly encouraging but he's probably best watched on this official debut; tongue-tie fitted.

runners.name: Glorious Ryder
runners.comment: Makes very limited appeal from stall 12 on this official debut
runners.spotlight: Displayed some improvement in his most recent trial but still makes very limited appeal from stall 12 on this official debut.

runners.name: Legend Star
runners.comment: A well-beaten outsider on first two starts (6f/7f); overlooked from stall 10 today
runners.spotlight: A well-beaten outsider on first two starts (6f/7f); overlooked from stall 10 today.

runners.name: Draco
runners.comment: Placed twice at start of this year but form has dipped slightly in recent weeks
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden; placed twice at start of this year (6f/7f) but form has dipped slightly in recent weeks; others have more pressing claims.

runners.name: My Intelligent
runners.comment: Back from layoff with three good runs this year; ought to make his presence felt again
runners.spotlight: Back from layoff with three good runs this year, the latest a C&D fourth six weeks ago; holds no secrets from the handicapper but ought to make his presence felt again.

runners.name: Gor Gor
runners.comment: Showed nothing more than minor promise when a big-priced outsider for recent debut (7f)
runners.spotlight: Showed nothing more than minor promise when a big-priced outsider for recent debut; drops back from 7f today.

runners.name: Always My Folks
runners.breeder: S F Bloodstock L L C
runners.comment: Eight-race maiden with very mixed record; went close over C&D this month, though
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden who already has a very mixed record; that said, he ran a big race when close second over C&D a fortnight ago and has obvious claims if in similar form again.

runners.name: Sugar Sugar
runners.comment: Latest run was slightly disappointing and he remains on a tough mark
runners.spotlight: Made the frame three consecutive times over C&D in March/April (twice from double-digit stalls) but his latest run was slightly disappointing and he remains on a fairly tough mark; others preferred.

runners.name: Harmony N Blessed
runners.owner: Cheung Ming Man, Cheung Ying Ho Et Al
runners.comment: Very well handicapped now but his recent efforts have been underwhelming
runners.spotlight: Now 11lb lower than when winning at Sha Tin early on in the season but recent efforts have been underwhelming and he needs to up his game.

runners.name: Beauty Infinity
runners.comment: Consistent 5yo who was placed off today's mark over C&D two weeks ago; in the mix again
runners.spotlight: Consistent 5yo who scored over C&D in March and stayed on for third here off today's mark a fortnight ago; probably won't be far away.

runners.name: View Of The World
runners.comment: Returned from short break with two down-the-field runs last month; has questions to answer
runners.spotlight: Won three times (6f/7f) in first half of season but returned from short break with two down-the-field runs last month (6f/5f) and now has some questions to answer.

runners.name: King Miles
runners.owner: Bernie Yim Mei Fung & Yim Man Hay
runners.comment: Back in good nick when runner-up over C&D on last two outings; good chance
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on early-season form and looked back in good nick when runner-up over C&D on last two outings; hooded for first time today; ought to be right in the thick of things again.

runners.name: Victory Sky
runners.comment: Went close from stall 11 over C&D last month and can make his presence felt again
runners.spotlight: Placed on four of his nine Hong Kong starts, most recently when close second over C&D from stall 11 three weeks ago; has to take a 3lb rise on the chin but ought to make his presence felt again.

runners.name: Another Zonda
runners.comment: 7f winner last month and ran just a well back at 6f on latest outing; well drawn; a player
runners.spotlight: Opened Hong Kong account with narrow 7f win at Sha Tin last month and coped fine with drop back to 6f when close fourth there 17 days ago; well drawn here; might still have a bit more to offer.

runners.name: Beauty Glory

prev_owners.owner: Sean Jones & Mrs L Lyons & Mrs A Brudenell & R Simmons

runners.comment: Front-runner; drops back in trip after string of good efforts over 7f
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who has made the frame four consecutive times over 7f at Sha Tin in recent weeks; also suited by 7f; no surprise if he gives this a good shot.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series (C & G) Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: He's a lovely horse who has done it well at home for a long time. He was only ready to start. He loved that ground and Colin [Keane] said he wouldn't want it any quicker. That trip and further [suits him], he'll have no problem getting a trip. He did that well and showed a good attitude, he'll only improve. He's a good-looking horse who we're delighted with - Shane Lyons, assistant to Ger Lyons, trainer of To Glory

runners.name: Denfield
runners.owner: Yue Yun Hing & Anita Yue Lam Chik Sun
runners.comment: Three-time C&D winner but always in Class 4; faces tough task from stall 11 today
runners.spotlight: Three-time C&D winner in Class 4; gave good account when fourth over C&D in this grade two starts ago but was soundly beaten last time and has another tough draw today.

runners.name: Lo Pan Spirit
runners.comment: In good form in recent months but is enduring a dreadful run of luck draw-wise
runners.spotlight: Dual 6f winner last season; placed on consecutive starts at Sha Tin in March/April and didn't run badly from stall 10 over C&D when last in action but his dreadful run of luck on the draw front has continued.

runners.name: Oliner

prev_owners.owner: T T Ngo, Dr W K A Lee & Bjorn Baker Racing

runners.comment: Absent since down-the-field run in December; favourable draw not enough to tempt
runners.spotlight: Stayed on for fourth at Sha Tin (5f) in December, his second start for Jamie Richards, but absent since a lesser run over that C&D in December; favourable draw not enough to tempt today.

runners.name: Tai Victory

prev_owners.owner: H H Ngan & P F Cheuk

runners.comment: Unable to land a telling blow on his first three Hong Kong starts; drawn wide today
runners.spotlight: Unable to land a telling blow on his first three Hong Kong starts and looks up against it again from stall 10 today.

runners.name: The Lion King

prev_owners.owner: M L R Whittaker, Mrs E M K Whittaker Et Al

runners.comment: Made winning debut in 6.2f maiden in Australia in September; not seen again since
runners.spotlight: Made winning debut in 6.2f maiden in Australia in September; not seen again since; sports tongue-tie/blinkers for Hong Kong debut; market may guide.

runners.name: Very Grateful
runners.comment: Scored over 7f on debut in New Zealand in November; first run in Hong Kong
runners.spotlight: Scored over 7f on debut in New Zealand in November; will be making his Hong Kong debut if he gets a run today; blinkers removed; tongue-tie added.

runners.name: Sky Trust
runners.owner: Bryan Kwan Hon Ming, Jessica Kwan Mun Hang Et Al
runners.comment: Won twice in early part of season; still in good form but current mark is quite tough
runners.spotlight: Dual winner at Sha Tin in early part of this season (7f/1m); still in pretty good form but does not have much margin for error off current mark and is drawn on the outside today.

runners.name: A Americ Te Specso
runners.breeder: Go Racing Ltd & L J Shannon
runners.comment: Best known as a sprinter but has won his last two over C&D; respected
runners.spotlight: Best known as a sprinter but has enjoyed a new lease of life over 1m in recent months; up another 6lb since last month's narrow C&D win but still enters calculations on this hat-trick attempt.

runners.name: Embraces
runners.owner: Thomas Chung Yat Fan & Joe Ho Pui Lung
runners.comment: Started off for Cody Mo with two 1m wins in December/January and is still in good form
runners.spotlight: Started off for Cody Mo with two 1m wins (one here) in December/January and has remained in good form since; not drawn well today but may yet have a bigger run in him.

runners.name: Star Contact
runners.comment: Lurks on a dangerous mark but has been out of form this year and needs to turn a corner
runners.spotlight: Lurks on a dangerous mark but has been out of form this year and needs to turn a corner.

runners.name: Dragon Joy
runners.breeder: Mrs A P, D E & R W E Moore
runners.comment: Dual winner this season but has suffered an alarming dip in form on recent outings
runners.spotlight: Dual winner this season, latterly when clinging on by a short head at Sha Tin in January, but has suffered an alarming dip in form on recent outings.

runners.name: King Of Fighters
runners.comment: Placed over 6f on three of last four outings and looks well worth another crack at 1m
runners.spotlight: 0-6 in Hong Kong but placed over 6f here on three of his last four appearances, and his Australian form suggests he's well worth another crack at 1m; high on the list.

runners.name: Prestige Always
runners.owner: Eric Yeung Ting Fung & Angel Wong Sau Kuen
runners.comment: Won over 7f in September but has gone right off the boil since the turn of the year
runners.spotlight: Opened Hong Kong account with 7f win at Sha Tin in September but has gone right off the boil since the turn of the year.

quotes.race: Claregalwayhotel.ie Irish EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: It was a very good run at the Curragh from Mythology the last day and he had a good run there the time before that as well. He deserved to get his head in front and he will get confidence from that. We think he is a horse who can hold his own in Group company as the season goes on. He'll probably go to Deauville in two weeks for a Group race. He handles a bit of juice but I think he would be fine on better ground too - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: Kolachi
runners.comment: Placed at triple-digit odds two starts ago but other two HK runs were very disappointing
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish 4yo; belied triple-digit odds when placed over C&D two starts ago but his other two Hong Kong runs were very disappointing; not an easy one to predict.

runners.name: Sturdy Ruby
runners.owner: Adam Chan Yam Man,Brian Wong Chi Fai & Alfred Chan Yam Lung
runners.comment: Dual Class 4 C&D winner this season and twice in the frame in this higher grade since
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner in Class 4 this season and has twice made the frame in this higher grade since; usually finishes well; holds each-way claims at least if this race is run to suit.

runners.name: Good Luck Babe
runners.comment: Just held on to make all in Sha Tin Class 4 last month; well beaten in this grade since
runners.spotlight: Just held on to make all in 1m Class 4 at Sha Tin contest last month, his ninth Hong Kong start, but was well beaten there when upped to this grade last time and may remain vulnerable at this level.

runners.name: Super Unicorn
runners.breeder: B J Lindsay Mnzm & Mrs J E A Lindsay
runners.comment: Signed off for Frankie Lor with two disappointing runs; blinkers on for stable debut
runners.spotlight: Won over C&D for Frankie Lor in October but signed off for him with two disappointing runs in March/April; needs combination of first-time blinkers and recent stable switch to revive his fortunes.

runners.name: Harold Win
runners.comment: Very consistent over 6f/7f; has inside draw for first 1m attempt
runners.spotlight: Has modest 1-15 strike-rate over 6f/7f but scores high marks for his consistency; close third in this grade at Sha Tin (7f) last month and has inside draw for first 1m attempt; won't be far away if stamina holds out.

runners.name: Absolute Honour

prev_owners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor

runners.comment: A very promising 2yo in Ireland last year but safely held on first four Hong Kong starts
runners.spotlight: A very promising 2yo in Ireland last year but safely held on first four Hong Kong starts, most recently when upped to 1m here two weeks ago.

quotes.race: Tipperary Races Median Auction Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Surpass is a work in progress, he's still very babyish and when he puts it all together he has the makings of a lovely horse. He could go for a race like the Tyros Stakes now - Chris Armstrong, stable representative.

runners.name: Sea Chariot
runners.comment: 3-13 in Ireland; makes Hong Kong debut after 226-day absence
runners.spotlight: 3-13 when based in Ireland, the latest win gained in heavy-ground handicap over 1m last October; won't mind if conditions are much quicker for this Hong Kong debut but probably best watched all the same.

quotes.race: Torc Travel Handicap
quotes.quote: Sea Chariot doesn't have many miles on the clock. We weren't sure about the ground today, but when I gave him a chance he got into a nice rhythm. He didn't ride like a slow horse - Colin Keane, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Sea Chariot was fresh today but they went a good gallop which suited. He's a horse that will pay his way up here for the winter - Shane Foley, rider.

runners.name: Happy Fat Cat
runners.comment: Bang-in-form front-runner who has won two of his last three over C&D; respected
runners.spotlight: Bang-in-form front-runner who has won two of his last three over C&D; up another 6lb since last time but has much better draw today; likely to make a bold bid.

runners.name: Superb Capitalist
runners.owner: Li Cham Kuen & Li Ming Choi
runners.comment: Latest run was a step back in the right direction but he's drawn wide again today
runners.spotlight: Took step back in right direction when very respectable fifth over C&D from stall 12 two weeks ago but has another tough draw to contend with today.

runners.name: Power Koepp
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Simon Ng Kar Ming
runners.comment: 2-3 for new stable but needs to find something extra to prevail again today
runners.spotlight: Resurgent 7yo who is 2-3 over C&D for his new stable; prevailed only by a short head on latter occasion, though, and is not so well drawn today; needs to find something extra.

runners.name: Nucleozor

prev_owners.owner: Te Akau Stud & Westonlea Bloodstock Partnership

runners.comment: 3-3 when based in New Zealand but safely held on first two Hong Kong starts
runners.spotlight: 3-3 in New Zealand last year, signing off with a 5f Listed win a year ago, but was safely held on his first two Hong Kong starts.

runners.name: Superb Boy
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Mak Yiu Hay & Mak Kai Chung
runners.comment: Seemed to have turned a corner on latest outing and has the plum inside stall today
runners.spotlight: Generally very disappointing since finishing second on seasonal debut in September but seemed to have turned a corner when close fourth over C&D three weeks ago; has the plum inside stall today and Hugh Bowman keeps the ride; one to consider.

runners.name: Romantic Son
runners.breeder: Hall Of Fame Bloodstock Pty Ltd
runners.comment: Two lesser efforts have followed his narrow C&D win in March; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Came good in Hong Kong at sixth attempt, with narrow C&D win in March, but two lesser efforts have followed and the handicapper has not budged.

runners.name: Eason
runners.comment: Consistent this season but on a long losing run and has the outside draw
runners.spotlight: Largely consistent this season but it's over two years since his latest win and he has the outside draw today.

runners.name: The Red Hare
runners.owner: Lo Yu Sai, Jasmine Lo Siu Yu Et Al
runners.comment: 2-3 in Australia last year; makes HK debut after seven-month absence; best watched
runners.spotlight: 2-3 in Australia last year, signing off with 6.7f handicap win last October; looks an interesting recruit to the Hong Kong scene but is entitled to benefit from this outing.

runners.name: Dragon Four Seas
runners.owner: Dr Alan Lee Wai Kin, Dr Kelvin Chong Man Yuk Et Al
runners.comment: Progressive 4yo; three 6f wins this year; ran well from tough draw last month; player
runners.spotlight: Progressive 4yo who has collected three wins this year, the last two over C&D; not discredited when six from double-digit draw here last month and Zac Purton takes the ride today; likely contender.

runners.name: Golden Rise
runners.owner: James Kwan Wai Ming & Leung Kam Chuen
runners.comment: Has held his own in this higher grade since C&D win in March but drawn wide today
runners.spotlight: Twice in the frame in this higher grade since narrow C&D win in March but managed only ninth from stall 1 here three weeks ago and has a double-digit draw today.

runners.name: Everstar
runners.owner: Jackie F C Hang, Colin L P Cheung & Fredrick F C Lun
runners.comment: Off the mark in Hong Kong with recent C&D win; moves back up in grade today
runners.spotlight: Came good in Hong Kong at seventh attempt, with clearcut C&D win three weeks ago; moves back up in grade today but might use that recent success as a springboard.

runners.name: Sovereign Fund
runners.breeder: S F Bloodstock L L C
runners.owner: Glenn Chan Wai Cheung & Raymond Chan Ka Shun

prev_owners.owner: Newgate Bloodstock, China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd Et Al

runners.comment: Class 4 C&D winner last month and close third in this grade on next outing; respected
runners.spotlight: Opened Hong Kong account with Class 4 C&D win last month and probably bettered that performance when close third in this higher grade three weeks ago; respected in current form.

runners.name: Sky Cap
runners.comment: Well beaten in this higher grade since surprise C&D win last month
runners.spotlight: Stayed on well to cause 29-1 surprise in Class 4 C&D contest two starts ago but finished well down the field in this higher grade a week ago; others have much more convincing profiles.

runners.name: Giant Leap
runners.comment: Took form to new level with quick C&D double last month; respected if he gets a run
runners.spotlight: 4yo who took his form to a new level last month; fended off Power Koepp to complete a quick C&D double five weeks ago and will warrant serious consideration if he gets a run today.
